entries: During the first round of combat, the first spell attack you make has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. You can't use this trick if you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Hookshot
entries: You can cast the {@spell Phantom Grapnel|ValdaSpire24} cantrip as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If you do so, its range is reduced to 15 feet. When you cast the spell as an action, the target is pulled an additional 10 feet toward you by the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal Force damage with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can roll a {@dice d6} on the following table to change the cantrip's damage type for this casting. You can apply tricks to the casting as normal using the new damage type. Additionally, you can apply the trick corresponding to the rolled damage type, even if you don't know the trick.
You can use this trick a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} that deals Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder damage, you can change the damage type to Radiant.

When you deal Radiant damage with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can reroll one of the cantrip's damage dice, and you must use the new roll. The number of damage dice you can reroll increases by 1 when you reach Warmage levels 11 (2 dice) and 17 (3 dice).

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Fortification
entries: You can cast the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip as an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If you cast it as an action, you can use one of the following effects.

entries.name: Repair
entries: You can restore a single nonmagical object, such as a door, Cart, or window, to pristine condition if at least half of its parts are present. This object can be no larger than 10 cubic feet, or 1 cubic foot if it is exceptionally complex (such as a clock).

entries.name: Fortify
entries: You can build simple fortifications, such as sealing a door shut, adding wooden planks to a window, or building a short stone wall (no larger than 10 cubic feet). You must have the materials present to use this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Severe Cantrip
entries: When a creature rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a saving throw against one of your Warmage cantrips, it suffers a Critical Failure. It fails the save regardless of its modifiers or the spell save DC. If the spell deals damage, you roll all of the spell's damage dice twice and add them together, then add any relevant modifiers. This additional damage applies only to the creature that rolled a 1.

optionalfeature.name: Silent Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns immediately after you deal Thunder damage to an enemy with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can create a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of magical silence originating from the target, which lasts until the start of your next turn. Any creature or object entirely inside the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Thunder damage, and creatures have the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a Verbal component is impossible there.

optionalfeature.name: Static Cantrip
entries: Whenever you deal Lightning damage to an enemy with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can sap part of the energy into a charge, which clings to your body until the start of your next turn. While charged, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} in response to taking damage from a creature you can see within 5 feet of you to deal Lightning damage equal to half your Warmage level to the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Force Aegis
entries: When you cast the {@spell Force Buckler|ValdaSpire24} cantrip, you can {@condition Concentration|XPHB|Concentrate} on it for up to 1 minute. The spell doesn't end early if you are hit by an attack.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Weaponmaster
entries: When you cast {@spell Force Weapon|ValdaSpire24} or {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24}, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make one additional spell attack with that cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Split Fire
entries: When you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} that requires a single spell attack roll, you can select multiple creatures and make a spell attack roll against each one. You can target a number of creatures equal to the number of damage dice the cantrip deals, and split your damage dice up amongst your targets, to a minimum of 1 die of damage per target. Each attack must target a different creature. For example, Fire Bolt deals {@damage 3d10} damage at level 5. You can choose to target three creatures and deal {@damage 1d10} damage to each creature, or you can target two creatures, dealing {@damage 1d10} damage to one creature and {@damage 2d10} damage to the other creature, or you can target one creature and deal {@damage 3d10} damage.

optionalfeature.name: Bishop's Maneuver
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend spell slot to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. The number of feet you can teleport equals 15 feet times the level of the spell slot expended.

optionalfeature.name: Capture
entries: You gain the following formation:

entries.name: Capture
entries: You can use this formation when you and three or more {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} that don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition are adjacent to an enemy and surround it. You can determine this by placing an imaginary cube around the enemy. If you and your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} are adjacent to each side of the cube, the creature is surrounded.

When you activate this formation, the enemy must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be enveloped by chains of magical force and have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The {@condition Stunned|XPHB} target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself and this formation on a success.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Castle
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose a willing Small or Medium creature you can see within 120 feet of you. You both teleport, swapping places.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Chips are Down
entries: When you expend one or more Chips of Fate to bet and lose at least one bet, you regain one expended Chip of Fate.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Steed
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell Find Steed|XPHB} without expending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you cast the spell using this trick, its spell slot level is your Wamage level divided by four, rounded up.

optionalfeature.name: Dartmaster
entries: When you cast a cantrip that allows you to make multiple ranged spell attacks, such as {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24} or {@spell Force Dart|ValdaSpire24} using the {@optfeature Split Fire|ValdaWarmage} trick, and you miss with one or more attacks, you can reroll all of your misses.
Once you use this trick, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Directed Momentum
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with a melee attack using a weapon or score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with one, you can make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against a second target. On a hit, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fold
entries: You have learned to graciously accept defeat using your Deck of Fate. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are hit by an attack, you can play your entire hand to cast {@spell Shield|XPHB} without expending a spell slot.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Force Breastplate
entries: While you have all of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage.

optionalfeature.name: Snake Eyes
entries: If you roll a 1 or 2 on a Die of Fate, you keep the die instead of giving it to the GM.

optionalfeature.name: Spellstrike
entries: Whenever you cast {@spell Arc Blade|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Burning Blade|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Frigid Blade|ValdaSpire24}, or {@spell True Strike|XPHB}, you can make two attacks as a part of the spell instead of one. You can only apply the cantrip's bonus damage to one of the attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Blitz
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to maneuver one of your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies}. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. Choose an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} within 60 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. That {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

optionalfeature.name: Check
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to threaten the target. Add the Battle Dice to the attack's damage roll. The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Flash of Brilliance
entries: When you fail an Intelligence or Wisdom check, you can expend one Battle Die to add it to the roll, potentially turning it into a success. You can only use this maneuver once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Gambit
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to give your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} an opening. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. The next creature other than yourself to make an attack roll against the target adds the Battle Die to the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Morale Boost
entries: When an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} you can see within 60 feet of yourself fails a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Battle Die and add it to the roll, potentially turning it into a success.

optionalfeature.name: Stalemate
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to hold that creature in place. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gingerbread Magic
entries: {@i Live in a Candyland}

Witches that learn the fine details of Gingerbread Magic become masters in all things confectionery. Some Witches, particularly those with a sweet tooth, use their magic to delight others. Evil gingerbread Witches, by contrast, have a penchant for cruelty, and use their delectable powers to tempt others into traps or transform valuables into sweet treats.

subclassFeature.name: Gingerbread Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Gingerbread Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Gingerbread Spells
rows: {@spell Arcane Lock|XPHB}, {@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB}, {@spell Hex: Sweet Tooth|ValdaWitch}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}
{@spell Create Food and Water|XPHB}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|XPHB|Tiny Hut}

subclassFeature.name: Sweet Tooth
entries: You gain the {@spell Hex: Sweet Tooth|ValdaWitch} cantrip. This cantrip is exclusive to this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Gingerbread Familiar
entries: When you summon your familiar, you can conjure a version of it made from gingerbread. It gains the following benefits:

items.name: Blindsight
entries: Your familiar has {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

items.name: Distracting Aroma
entries: An enemy within 5 feet of the familiar that can see and smell it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against creatures other than it.

items.name: Fragile
entries: Your familiar only adds your Witch level, instead of twice your Witch level, to its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Sugar Rush
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can give an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} you touch a burst of quickly-fading energy. The {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sugar-Coat
entries: When a creature that you can see hits you with an attack roll using a weapon, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to transform its weapon into a harmless duplicate made of candy. You choose the type of candy it is made out of, whether it be marshmallow, cotton candy, or gingerbread. You take no damage from the attack. The weapon remains transformed and unable to deal damage until the end of the attacker's turn. The attacker can make attacks using other weapons or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} as normal.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 3+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Candy Land
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can transform an area into a field of confectionary delights. Choose a point you can see within 120 feet. For 1 minute, a 30-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of magic centered on that point transforms every nonmagical object entirely within the area that isn't being worn or carried into an edible candy replica. Structures become gingerbread houses, trees are made of chocolate, and so on. The GM decides the type of candy into which objects are transformed. Candy objects have no damage threshold and {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to all damage. A candy object reverts to its original material at the end of the duration or if it leaves the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}, unless it is eaten.

The {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} lasts for 1 minute, until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or if you dismiss it (no action required). Additionally, everything inside the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} appears to be joyous and colorful. Whenever you or an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} starts its turn inside the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}, it regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. A creature doesn't gain this benefit if it has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Green Magic
entries: {@i Wield Nature and an Empowered Familiar}

Plants, nature, and things that grow are the domain of Green Magic. Normally a branch of arcana championed by Druids, some Witches have a close tie to the powers of Green Magic and can coax plants and animals to do their bidding.

subclassFeature.name: Green Magic Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Green Magic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Green Magic Spells
rows: {@spell Barkskin|XPHB}, {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB}, {@spell Entangle|XPHB}, {@spell Goodberry|XPHB}, {@spell Locate Animals or Plants|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Elder Tongue
entries: You always have the {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it without a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Ally
entries: You add three times your Witch level, instead of twice your Witch level, to your familiar's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Twin Familiar
entries: When you summon your familiar, you can divide its spirit into two bodies. When summoned in this way, your familiar is two identical creatures that share a single pool of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Your twin familiars act on subsequent turns. You can use your Quick Attack twice on the same turn, using an action to command one twin and a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command the other. A spell or feature that targets or dismisses your familiar affects both twins.

subclassFeature.name: Vital Nourishment
entries: You exude an aura of Green Magic that restores and reinvigorates life around you. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, plant life within 120 feet of where you finished your {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} grows as if a month had passed with abundant food, water, and other necessities. If the plants would produce fruits, berries, or vegetables, the plants grow enough food to feed six creatures for one day.

Additionally, choose up to six creatures you can see at the end of the rest. Those creatures each gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Witch level + your Charisma modifier. You can also end one of the following conditions affecting each creature: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Familiar
entries: Whenever you are targeted by an attack while your familiar is within 5 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to command it to dive in the way of the attack, causing the attack to target your familiar instead.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Magic
entries: {@i Cut Down Foes with the Soulsword}

Secret covens throughout the Material Plane practice their magic by drawing spells into their blades. Maniacally cackling and whirling their way across the battlefield, these Witches weave their curses into a bloody tapestry whenever they bring their steel to bear.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Steel Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Steel Spells
rows: {@spell Heat Metal|XPHB}, {@spell Heroism|XPHB}, {@spell Magic Weapon|XPHB}, {@spell Shield|XPHB}, {@spell True Strike|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Martial Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons that don't have {@itemProperty H|XPHB|Heavy} and training with Medium armor and Shields.

subclassFeature.name: Soulsteel
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can draw the essence of your familiar into a Melee weapon that you are holding, manifesting in a cloak of green flame. This weapon becomes your Soulsteel weapon. Your familiar is temporarily dismissed until this effect ends at the end of your next turn. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Damage
entries: When you hit with your Soulsteel weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage. This damage is your choice of Force, Necrotic, or Radiant.

entries.name: Cackling Killer
entries: When you {@classFeature Cackle|Witch|ValdaWitch|2}, you can extend the duration of this feature by 1 round.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use your Soulsteel weapon as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.
In addition, you can cast one of your cantrips (including your Hexes) that has a casting time of an action in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Insidious Smite
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your Soulsteel weapon, you can expend a level 5 or lower spell slot to deal extra damage equal to {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot. This damage is your choice of Force, Necrotic, or Radiant.

subclassFeature.name: Hexplate
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage dealt by an enemy that is the sole target of your Hex.

subclassFeature.name: Black Magic
entries: {@i Wield the Dark Arts}

Black magic is associated with Hexes that cause suffering and spells that give rise to undeath. Harnessing such magic can lend you great power, but inevitably carries a cost. Darkness cannot be contained, after all; it merely seeps forth from wherever it is kept.

subclassFeature.name: Black Magic Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Black Magic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Black Magic Spells
rows: {@spell Exhume|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB}, {@spell Hex: Decay|ValdaWitch}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Decay
entries: You gain the {@spell Hex: Decay|ValdaWitch} cantrip. This cantrip is exclusive to this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Undeath Command
entries: Your authority over Undead grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Quick Command
entries: When you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command your familiar, you can use the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to issue a command to any Undead you control via the {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

entries.name: Undead Familiar
entries: Undead you control via the {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} spell gain the benefits of the Witch Familiar sidebar.

subclassFeature.name: Life Tether
entries: When you take damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to transfer some of that damage to a creature that is the sole target of your Hex. You take half the damage (round down) and the hexed creature takes the remaining damage.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Grim Sacrifice
entries: If your familiar is within 60 feet of yourself, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to dissolve its magical bond to this plane. Your familiar drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and unleashes necromantic energy in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature you choose within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature takes {@damage 8d10} Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 6+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: White Magic
entries: {@i Heal and Mend a Broken World}

White Magic is fundamentally good and benevolent for all living things. Witches that adopt this craft, in spite of the hateful curse that infects them, often dedicate themselves to healing and caretaking.

subclassFeature.name: White Magic Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the White Magic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: White Magic Spells
rows: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Prayer of Healing|XPHB}, {@spell Spare The Dying|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Remedy
entries: You have a reservoir of healing magic represented by a pool of d6s. The number of dice in this pool equals your Witch level.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can heal yourself or one creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself, expending one or more dice from the pool. You can expend a maximum number of dice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). Roll the dice you expend, and add your Charisma modifier to the roll if you use this feature as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, restoring a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total.
Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Talisman of Protection
entries: You can craft a magical talisman that wards off harm. Creating a talisman takes 1 hour of work, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can only have one of these talismans at a time; crafting a new talisman causes the previous one to become nonmagical. Any creature wearing the talisman adds a {@dice d4} to all saving throws it makes.

subclassFeature.name: Benevolent Surge
entries: When you, your familiar, or an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause that creature to regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your Charisma modifier.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Witch's Gift
entries: Whenever you cast a spell or use a Witch feature that restores a creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, that creature gains a +3 bonus to its {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Purple Magic
entries: {@i Enchant and Beguile Your Foes}

Purple Magic holds sway over the domains of illusions and enchantments that take hold over people's minds, as well as anything that is not quite as it seems. Practitioners of this craft are puppet masters, shaping the apparent reality around them with the ease of a marionette.

subclassFeature.name: Purple Magic Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Purple Magic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Purple Magic Spells
rows: {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, {@spell Hex: Hallucination|ValdaWitch}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Silent Image|XPHB}, {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Hallucination
entries: You gain the {@spell Hex: Hallucination|ValdaWitch} cantrip. This cantrip is exclusive to this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: False Authority
entries: When you cast {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, you can modify it so that you appear as a figure of authority to anyone who sees you. You don't choose your appearance; rather, your appearance varies from observer to another. For example, a blacksmith might see you as a guild master, whereas a soldier might see you as a captain.

subclassFeature.name: Deceitful Transposition
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to create an illusory disguise over two creatures within 60 feet of yourself, making it seem as if they have teleported and switched places. The disguise extends to the target's voices, sounds, smells, etc. Disguised creatures don't perceive any part of the illusion.

A creature can take a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine a magically disguised creature and make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature can see both illusory creatures for what they are.

This illusion lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if either disguised creature takes an action that the other can't take (such as casting a spell), if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or if you dismiss it (no action required).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Waking Nightmare
entries: You can warp everything a creature sees into a hellscape full of terrible creatures. When a creature fails its saving throw against your {@spell Hex: Hallucination|ValdaWitch} cantrip, you can further distort its mind. The creature has the Frenzied condition. A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one. The Frenzied condition ends after 1 minute, or when the spell ends.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Fragrant Magic
entries: {@i Choke Foes and Enchant Allies}

Magic based on the swirling smoke of strong-smelling herbs has been practiced since the time of ancient elves. Today, the discipline, a mix of aromatherapy and mystical arcana, is kept alive by the so-called "perfumed Witches", who can purify the body and still the mind with their collection of fragrances and herbal smokes. Their Fragrant Magic, however, is not always evident. Sometimes, it would appear their magic is more about relaxation and meditation, while other times, they summon foul clouds that disorientate and kill.

subclassFeature.name: Fragrant Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Fragrant Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Fragrant Spells
rows: {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB}, {@spell Color Spray|XPHB}, {@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB}, {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Fragrant Aura
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can create a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of fragrance, which lasts for 1 minute, until you use this feature again to choose a different effect, or you dismiss it (no action required). You choose the type of fragrance from the following options. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Frankincense
entries: Each creature you choose in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Smelling Salts
entries: Each {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} creature you choose in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} awakens if it has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. Additionally, each creature in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition and can't be magically put to sleep.

entries.name: Sulfur
entries: Each creature you choose in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution checks and saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Smoke Rings
entries: Whenever you create smoke, such as when you burn herbs or incense or cast {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, you can shape it in any manner you choose.

subclassFeature.name: Aromamancy
entries: You can manipulate your magical fragrances to alter your magic, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Incense Casting
entries: When you cast a Witch spell, you can burn a stick of incense to cast it without spell components. A Witch spell you cast in this way can't be affected by {@spell Counterspell|XPHB}. If the spell requires Material components that have a cost specified in the spell, you must burn incense of equal value. A block of incense is worth 2 GP and contains 10 sticks of incense, each worth 2 SP.

entries.name: Perfumed Charisma
entries: You can expend a spell slot as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to create and apply a magical perfume to yourself. For 1 hour, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Charisma checks made to influence a creature within 5 feet of yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Dizzying Fog
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can release a cloud of multi-hued smoke in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature you choose within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} creature repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Olfactory Aura
entries: You are constantly surrounded by a flowery fog in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Whenever an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, it can add a {@dice d4} to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Magic
entries: {@i Conjure the Magic of the Moon}

The moon is a potent symbol for many Witches— especially those who practice their craft incognito. To them it represents a guiding light in the darkness, a confidant or keeper of secrets, and a link to the powerful natural forces that govern time and tide. Lunar Witches are the masters of the night: shadowy, mercurial, and formidable.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Lunar Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Lunar Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Darkness|XPHB}, {@spell Moonbeam|XPHB}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}, {@spell Starry Wisp|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Moonsight
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Hexlight
entries: You can cast {@spell Moonbeam|XPHB} once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Whenever you start casting the spell, you can modify it so that the spell's duration becomes 1 round, ending at the end of your next turn. When you {@classFeature Cackle|Witch|ValdaWitch|2}, the spell's duration extends by 1 round, up to a maximum of 1 minute, and you can use the spell's {@action Magic|XPHB} action to move the beam as a part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Cover of Darkness
entries: You and your familiar can attempt to hide when {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB}. Additionally, you can add your Charisma modifier to any Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check you make as a part of the {@action Hide|XPHB} action (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Moon
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain a blessing based on a phase of the moon. You can choose the blessing of any moon phase, and the blessing is empowered if it's the moon's current phase. The GM determines the current phase, or determines it randomly on the Moon Phases table. You can use the benefit of your blessing once and regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Crescent Moon
entries: When an enemy you can see within 30 feet of you moves, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. If the moon is currently a crescent moon, you can teleport up to 60 feet.

entries.name: Full Moon
entries: When you fail a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reroll it with a bonus equal to your half your Witch level (round down). You must use the new roll. If the moon is currently a full moon, you add your Witch level, instead of half your Witch level, to the roll.

entries.name: New Moon
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose a -5 penalty to the roll, potentially causing the attack to miss you. If the moon is currently a new moon, you impose a -10 penalty to the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Moon Beam
entries: Whenever you cast {@spell Moonbeam|XPHB}, the spell creates a 10-foot- radius {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder}. If you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} using the spell, the area expands to a 15-foot-radius {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} for the duration of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Red Magic
entries: {@i Lay Your Foes to Waste with Arcane Fury}

Arcane magic tied to channeling the elements is deemed Red Magic, and is extremely hazardous when used. Witches that specialize in this craft are among the deadliest spellcasters in existence, channeling their curse into unhindered arcane wrath.

subclassFeature.name: Red Magic Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Red Magic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Red Magic Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB}, {@spell Dragon's Breath|XPHB}, {@spell Hex: Imperil|ValdaWitch}, {@spell Magic Missile|XPHB}, {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Imperil
entries: You gain the {@spell Hex: Imperil|ValdaWitch} cantrip. This cantrip is exclusive to this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Convolute Energy
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself deals Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage to one or more creatures, you can change that damage type to one of the other listed types (no action required).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Invulnerability
entries: When a creature that you can see hits you with an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage you take from the attack by 50, to a minimum of 0.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 4+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Annihilation
entries: When you cast a level 1+ Witch spell that deals Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage, you can expend another spell slot of equal or higher level to deal maximum damage with that spell on the turn you cast it.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Sky Magic
entries: {@i Soar Through the Sky With Ease}

Although all Witches appreciate a good {@item Broom of Flying|XDMG}, Sky Magic Witches embrace the power of the winds. Known colloquially as "Cloud Witches", they spend as much time aloft as they do on the ground, floating over their contemporaries with a breezy disposition.

subclassFeature.name: Sky Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Sky Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Sky Spells
rows: {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB}, {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}, {@spell Message|XPHB}, {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Feathered Heels
entries: A pair of magical feathers adorn each of your heels, granting you limited flight. When you cast a Hex or a spell using a spell slot, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} until the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Cushioned Fall
entries: You can cast {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB} on yourself without a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Corvid Familiar
entries: When you summon your familiar, you can transform it into a crowlike hybrid with black feathers and beady eyes. It gains the following benefits.

entries.name: Flight
entries: It gains a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 50 feet (unless it already has a faster {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB}).

entries.name: Aerial Agility
entries: While the familiar is flying, it has a +2 bonus to its AC.

entries.name: Common
entries: It can speak and understand Common.

entries.name: Flyby
entries: The target doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

subclassFeature.name: Vortex
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can create a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of twisting wind originating from you. The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} lasts for 1 minute, until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or you dismiss it (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required). The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has the following effects.

entries.name: Difficult Terrain
entries: The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for creatures you choose.

entries.name: Disadvantage for Ranged Attacks
entries: Ranged attacks through the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. Heavy projectiles, such as boulders and ballista bolts, are unaffected.

entries.name: Disperse Gasses
entries: The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} disperses gasses and vapor within its area.

entries.name: Windswept
entries: Small or smaller flying creatures can't move through the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}.

subclassFeature.name: Cloud Dancer
entries: Whenever you are hit by an attack while you are flying or falling, roll a {@dice d4}. On a 4, the attack misses you.

subclassFeature.name: Tea Magic
entries: {@i Glimpse and Shape the Future Through Tea Leaves}

Witches that practice Tea Magic learn to brew magically delicious and restorative tea, as well as to glimpse the future in their tea leaves. They are among the calmest and friendliest of Witches, at worst cranky (if forced to drink their tea in a hurry) or twitchy (after too much tea).

subclassFeature.name: Tea Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Tea Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Tea Spells
rows: {@spell Augury|XPHB}, {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB}, {@spell Guidance|XPHB}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Tasseography
entries: You see glimpses of the future in tea leaves. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, roll a {@dice d20} and record the number rolled. This is a fortelling roll. Before the start of your next turn, you can replace one {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made by you or a creature you can see within 60 feet with this roll. You must choose to do so before the roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Tea Ceremony
entries: You can magically conjure enough tea for you and up to six {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} whenever you take a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. The {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, of a creature that drinks this tea decreases by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Shapes and Omens
entries: You can see deeper glimpses into the future through your tea leaves. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can examine the shape of your tea leaves. The GM tells you a shape that hints at future events. For example, if you see a tower in your tea leaves, you might encounter a wizard on the following day. If you see a serpent, you might encounter a lair or a monster. When you encounter an event hinted at by your tea leaves, you gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Herbal Remedy
entries: When a creature drinks your tea as a part of your Tea Ceremony, it can gain one of the following benefits of its choice. Once it gains a benefit from this feature, it can't do so again until it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Invigoration
entries: The creature gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Witch level.

entries.name: Purification
entries: The creature has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and also has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on itself. This benefit lasts until the creature finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Restoration
entries: The creature gains the benefits of either the {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} or the {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} spell.

subclassFeature.name: As Foretold
entries: You regain all expended uses of your Tasseography feature when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Technicolor Magic
entries: {@i Make Friends and Sing Songs}

Technicolor Witches draw their magic from the power of friendship. They have a penchant for collecting adorable animals of all shapes and sizes, which they will never endanger, no matter how dire the situation. Above all, these Witches are defined by their relentless positivity, which empowers their arcana and spurs on their {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies}.

subclassFeature.name: Technicolor Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Technicolor Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Technicolor Spells
rows: {@spell Animal Messenger|XPHB}, {@spell Color Spray|XPHB}, {@spell Hex: Musical Interlude|ValdaWitch}, {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB}, {@spell Warding Bond|XPHB}
{@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond|XPHB|Telepathic Bond}, {@spell Teleportation Circle|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Musical Interlude
entries: You gain the {@spell Hex: Musical Interlude|ValdaWitch} cantrip. This cantrip is exclusive to this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Friends
entries: Your affinity for cuddly animals grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Charismatic Handling
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}) checks equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Pocket Pet
entries: If you adopt a Beast as a pet, you can temporarily dismiss it into an extradimensional space, as you would a familiar.

subclassFeature.name: Friendship Bracelet
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can weave a small magical bracelet of string, beads, or some other inexpensive material. You can have a number of these bracelets up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). If you make another one, you must render an existing bracelet nonmagical. A creature wearing one of your bracelets gains the following benefits.

entries.name: Helping Hand
entries: You can take the {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to assist a creature wearing one of your bracelets. Once you do so, you can't use this benefit to assist that creature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Sense Location
entries: You can always determine the location of a creature wearing one of your bracelets, as long as you and it are on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Targetable
entries: You can target a creature wearing one of your bracelets with spells and effects, even if you can't see it, as long as the target is within range.

subclassFeature.name: Positivity
entries: You can leverage your bonds of friendship for protection. When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain a bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equal to the number of friendly creatures within 5 feet of you (to a maximum of +10), potentially causing the attack to miss you instead.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Redemption Arc
entries: You can redeem your foes instead of slaying them. When an enemy you can see is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to protect the creature from further harm. Instead of dropping to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the creature drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} and has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. The condition ends early for it if it regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. When the creature awakens, any magical effect causing it to be {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, cursed, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, or possessed ends. Furthermore, the creature becomes {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Magic
entries: {@i Fuel Your Curses with Blood}

Forbidden by most Witch covens, Blood Magic centers on the use of dark spells and Hexes that draw from the spellcaster's life essence. It is fundamentally more perilous than other Witch crafts, but its many risks come with copious rewards.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Blood Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Blood Spells
rows: {@spell Melf's Acid Arrow|XPHB|Acid Arrow}, {@spell Hex: Blood Curse|ValdaWitch}, {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Hollowing Curse|ValdaSpire24}

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse
entries: You gain the {@spell Hex: Blood Curse|ValdaWitch} cantrip. This cantrip is exclusive to this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Novice Hemomancy
entries: You can use a drop of blood in place of a spell's Material components if those materials aren't consumed by the spell and don't have a cost specified.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Bloodletting
entries: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action, you can choose to take 5 Necrotic damage to change the casting time to a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} for this casting. This damage ignores your {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Deathseeker
entries: You can detect the location of each creature within 60 feet of you that is missing any of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and you can see such a creature if it has the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks you make to track any creature that you or your familiar has damaged within the last 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Hemomantic Recovery
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can perform a blood ritual to expend {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} and recover expended level 1-5 spell slots. The cost for each spell slot is given on the Hemomantic Recovery table.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine
entries: When you cast a spell with a spell slot that deals damage to a creature that is the sole target of your Hex, you can choose to sacrifice your blood for power. You take 5 or more Necrotic damage and the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage for every 5 Necrotic damage you took, to a maximum of {@damage 6d8} Necrotic damage. This damage ignores your {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Blue Magic
entries: {@i Copy Any Spell That Affects You}

Compared to all other Witch's crafts, Blue Magic is unique, in that it reflects the essence of magic itself. Witches that specialize in Blue Magic absorb the energy of spells that affect them and let the arcana imprint upon their souls.

entries.name: True Blue Variant
entries: "True" Blue Magic Witches abandon the ability to prepare spells entirely. This variant allows a character to be fully shaped by their experiences and duplicate spells up to level 9.
True Blue Witches don't prepare additional spells after Witch level 1. Instead, each new spell must be prepared through {@subclassFeature Blue Magic Duplication|Witch|ValdaWitch|Blue|ValdaWitch|3}.

As normal, a True Blue can't prepare more spells than listed in the Prepared Spells column of the Witch Features table. This number of prepared spells is increased by 4 at Witch level 3 (+4), and by 2 at Witch levels 5 (+6), 7 (+8), and 9 (+10).

subclassFeature.name: Blue Magic Duplication
entries: You learn spells through experience. When a spell of level 1+ targets you or you are in the area of a spell's effect, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to absorb some of that spell's energy. You always have that spell prepared. You can't use this feature to prepare a spell that had no effect on you, even if it forced you to make a saving throw against it.

You can only prepare a spell if it is of a level for which you have spell slots. You can prepare two spells of each level, from level 1-5, for a total of 10 spells prepared. When you prepare a new spell, you can replace a spell of the same level you have prepared with this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Awareness
entries: You always have the {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it without a spell slot. Additionally, while this spell is active, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to examine a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself and determine if it can cast spells.

subclassFeature.name: Turquoise Efficiency
entries: You have greater mastery over spells you have prepared, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Prepared Advantage
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make against any spell that you have prepared.

entries.name: Siphon Spell
entries: If you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that you have prepared that is cast by another creature, you can regain an expended spell slot of the same level. Once you regain a spell slot with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Copycat
entries: You can copy a creature's skills, in addition to its magic. When you see a creature within 60 feet of yourself makes an ability check using a skill or a saving throw in which it has proficiency, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to duplicate that proficiency. Until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you have proficiency in that skill or saving throw and can use the creature's bonus whenever you make that roll.

subclassFeature.name: Cerulean Reflection
entries: When a creature casts a spell that forces you to make a saving throw to avoid damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to attempt to redirect some of the spell's energy to a new target. If you succeed on your saving throw against the spell, choose another creature you can see within the spell's range or up to 30 feet away from you, whichever is closer, to make a saving throw against the spell, using your spell save DC. The chosen creature can be the original spellcaster. On a failed save, the creature suffers the effects of the spell as if you had cast the spell and it had been the original target or been within the area of the spell.
You can use this feature and {@subclassFeature Blue Magic Duplication|Witch|ValdaWitch|Blue|ValdaWitch|3} as a part of the same {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: House of Go
entries: {@i Dominate Your Foes Through Cunning Formations}

The renowned House of Go predates the other Warmage colleges by centuries. Unlike its successors, the strategies pioneered by the House of Go focus upon formations and cooperation, rather than individual excellence. Which isn't to suggest that Warmages of this college are anything other than brilliant strategists—they rival the House of Kings in this regard. Rather, the footsoldiers of the House of Go are greater than the sum of their parts, fluidly adopting motions to isolate and flank their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Formations
entries: You learn special tactics called Formations. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to activate one of the following Formations, which lasts until you and your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} are no longer in that formation, you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, die, or activate a different formation.

entries.name: Flank
entries: You can use this formation when you and an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} that doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition are adjacent to an enemy and on opposite sides of it. You can determine this by tracing a 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} from your space. If this line passes through the center of all three spaces, the enemy is flanked. You and your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against the flanked creature.

entries.name: Solo
entries: You can use this formation when you have no {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} within 5 feet of you. While in this formation, if you target a creature with a cantrip, that creature can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against you for the rest of the turn or until you are no longer in this formation, whether or not you deal damage with the cantrip.

entries.name: Wall
entries: You can use this formation when you and two to six {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} that don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition are within 5 feet of another {@variantrule Ally|XPHB}. Each creature in this formation (including you), gains a +2 bonus to its AC.

subclassFeature.name: Opening Strategy
entries: You can spend 10 minutes planning an encounter in exact detail. When you do so, you can share your plan with up to six {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} that understands the plan can gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an attack roll or ability check it makes within the next 10 minutes. If an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} rolls {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} during this time, it can't use this feature to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} after the end of the first round of combat.
Once you use this feature to make a plan, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hardened Formations
entries: While you are in a formation, any {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against you or an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} in your formation becomes a normal hit.

subclassFeature.name: Chain of Liberties
entries: Your formation moves as if your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} were links in a chain. Whenever you move on your turn, any number of willing {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} in your formation can move the same distance.

subclassFeature.name: End Game
entries: On your turn, when you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can cast another cantrip as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can apply {@classFeature Warmage Edge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|1} to this cantrip, even if you have already used it on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: House of Lancers
entries: {@i Deliver Cantrips Through Hand-to-Hand Arcana}

Warmages who join the House of Lancers are trained in fluid martial arts and meditative asceticism, melding the stoic discipline of monks with potent spellcasting. As such, they are unarmed elemental warriors, self-reliant and capable of feats unmatched by their peers. However, Lancers are notoriously neutral and abstain from the politics of the other Warmage houses. Lancers derive their name from an ancient precursor to the pawn, a piece remembered only in early variants of chess. It is a relic from a forgotten age, rife with symbolism.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield|XPHB}, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Hand-to-Hand Arcana
entries: You have been trained in the Lancers' unarmed combat technique, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Unarmed Strike
entries: You can make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike Damage
entries: You can roll a {@dice d6} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. The damage die changes when you reach levels 5 ({@dice d8}), 11 ({@dice d10}), and 17 ({@dice d12}).

entries.name: Intelligent Strikes
entries: You can use Intelligence instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. In addition, when you use the Grapple or Shove option of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Strength modifier to determine the save DC.

entries.name: Weaponized Fists
entries: Your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} counts as a Melee weapon with a cost of 1 GP for the purposes of Material components.

subclassFeature.name: Shock Trooper
entries: Whenever you make a melee attack on your turn against a creature you can see, you can lunge up to 15 feet toward your target before making the attack. Doing so doesn't spend movement or provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. You can perform this movement even if it causes you to travel through the air, though you fall after making the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Physicality
entries: Your Lancer training has heightened your body and mind, granting the following benefits.

entries.name: Force Damage
entries: Whenever you deal damage with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

entries.name: Ignore Difficult Terrain
entries: {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement.

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: Whenever you make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check, you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of the normal modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Evasion
entries: When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail.
You don't benefit from this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Shock Trooper
entries: You can lunge up to 30 feet using your {@subclassFeature Shock Trooper|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Lancers|ValdaWarmage|3} feature. This movement causes you to teleport through creatures and objects, blinking to the target in an instant. You can't teleport into an occupied space.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry of Spells
entries: You can cast spells with superhuman speed. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|5} feature to cast three different cantrips that have a casting time of an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can't use your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|5} feature on any of these cantrips.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: House of Pawns
entries: {@i Master Cantrips and Warmage Tricks}

By far the most prominent Warmage house is that of the Pawns. Warmages who join the House of Pawns learn to stretch their skill with cantrips to its limits. Pawns can master any cantrip or strategy, for they embody the adaptability to which all Warmages aspire.

subclassFeature.name: Promotion
entries: As a Pawn, you have trained as the quintessential Warmage. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you use this feature to choose a different benefit.

entries.name: Adaptive Magic
entries: You learn one {@filter Warmage trick|optionalfeatures|source=ValdaWarmage|feature type=wt} of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites and one {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} of your choice. This trick doesn't count against your number of tricks known.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Medium armor and Shields.

subclassFeature.name: Pawn Storm
entries: You can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls. Additionally, when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Multidiscipline
entries: You can add half your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (round down) to any saving throw you make that doesn't otherwise use your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

subclassFeature.name: Pawn Wall
entries: Whenever you deal damage with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you and up to two {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} within 5 feet of you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Fundamental Mastery
entries: Your magic always finds its way to your foes' most vulnerable spots. Once per turn when you roll damage for a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can choose one damage die and treat it as having rolled its maximum value.

subclassFeature.name: House of Knights
entries: {@i Wield Blades of Fire, Lightning, Frost, and Force}

The House of Knights has a long and storied tradition of melding swordplay with the Warmage's potent spellcasting. Unlike other warriors, however, Knights carry neither swords nor shields into combat, for they can forge both out of magical force at a moment's notice.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Medium armor, Heavy armor, and Shields. You can ignore the Strength requirement for wearing Heavy armor and wielding weapons with {@itemProperty H|XPHB|Heavy}.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Armament
entries: Your melding of swordplay and arcana grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Martial Cantrips
entries: You learn the {@spell Force Buckler|ValdaSpire24} and one of the following cantrips of your choice: {@spell Arc Blade|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Burning Blade|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Frigid Blade|ValdaSpire24}, or {@spell True Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Manifest Weapon
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can create a Simple or Martial Melee weapon made of magical force in your hand. This weapon counts as being worth 1 GP for the purposes of Material components. You can use this weapon as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}.

Whenever you attack with the manifested weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. The weapon deals Force damage or its normal damage type.
The weapon vanishes at the end of your turn if you aren't holding it.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice. Whenever you gain a Warmage level, you can replace the feat you chose with a different Fighting Style feat.

subclassFeature.name: Knight's Ward
entries: You can raise a hardened magical barrier between you and your foes. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Warmage level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Maneuver
entries: You can spend up to 30 feet of movement to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. The destination can be a number of feet away from you equal to half the movement you spend.

subclassFeature.name: Field of Blades
entries: You can summon a whirlwind of mystical weapons for a flurry of strikes. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can make a melee spell attack against up to five creatures you can see within 30 feet of you. Make a separate attack roll for each target. On a hit, a target takes Force damage equal to {@dice 2d10} + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: House of Dice
entries: {@i Tempt Fate with Chaotic Die Rolls}

The House of Dice throws out the Warmage convention of meticulous, deliberate spellcasting in favor of wild, chaotic magic that presses the odds. Everything from their magical bursts to their enchanted sets of dice can fail horribly, so it's auspicious that they often keep their fingers on the scales of fate. These Warmages have mastered not only a repertoire of cantrips, but also techniques to manipulate fortune itself, allowing them to risk everything, and more than often come out on top.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Your light fingers and unscrupulous tactics help you win the day. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB} skill and with the {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} ({@item dice set|XPHB}), if you don't already have it.

subclassFeature.name: Dice of Fate
entries: You gain four Dice of Fate, which are d6s. Whenever you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} or make a damage roll, you can expend one Die of Fate and add it to the roll, potentially causing the {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} to succeed. Once you expend a Die of Fate, it goes to the GM, who can expend it to add it to a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} or a damage roll made by an NPC or monster. When the GM expends a die, it passes back to you, and so on. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you regain all of your expended Dice of Fate, whether or not the GM has used them.
Beginning at level 7, you have an additional two Dice of Fate, and you can add two Dice of Fate at once to your damage rolls with Warmage cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Chaos Roll
entries: You can expend two of your {@subclassFeature Dice of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Dice|ValdaWarmage|3} as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, rolling them on the table below to create a chaotic surge of energy.

rows: You cast {@spell Fireball|XPHB} centered on yourself.
Your AC is reduced by 2 until the start of your next turn.

Until the start of your next turn, each creature within a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you can only speak in a babbling nonsense language and can't cast spells with a Verbal component.

A 5-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of butterflies, insects, or doves fills a location you choose within 60 feet of you. The {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.
You gain 7 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, and you keep the {@subclassFeature Dice of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Dice|ValdaWarmage|3} instead of giving them to the GM.
You have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn, as per the {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} spell.
An object within 60 feet of you chosen by the GM explodes, dealing no damage to you or your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies}, and dealing {@damage 3d6} Fire damage to one creature caught in the blast.

You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Each creature within 5 feet of the destination must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d6} Force damage.
Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature takes 4d6 Necrotic damage and you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage taken.
You cast {@spell Lightning Bolt|XPHB} and can add the {@subclassFeature Dice of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Dice|ValdaWarmage|3} to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Loaded Dice
entries: You can subtly cheat your dice. Once on each of your turns when you roll a {@dice d6}, you can flip the die upside down. Note that on a balanced {@dice d6}, the top and bottom numbers add up to 7, so you can determine the bottom number by subtracting the top number from 7.

subclassFeature.name: Twisted Fate
entries: When you make an attack roll or ability check with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your turn, you can attempt to invert fate as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Expend a {@subclassFeature Dice of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Dice|ValdaWarmage|3|ValdaWarmage|Die of Fate} and roll it. On a 5, you ignore {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the roll. On a 6, you instead have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Roll the Bones
entries: You can channel the chaotic energy of your dice in an instant. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you take damage from a creature you can see, you can expend two {@subclassFeature Dice of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Dice|ValdaWarmage|3} to make a {@subclassFeature Chaos Roll|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Dice|ValdaWarmage|3}.

subclassFeature.name: Steal Luck
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, roll a {@dice d6}. You steal that many {@subclassFeature Dice of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Dice|ValdaWarmage|3} back from the GM.

subclassFeature.name: House of Darts
entries: {@i Make Bullseye Shots with Ranged Cantrips}

Every Warmage understands the importance of precision, but the House of Darts flaunts a competitive excellence when it comes to landing shots. Daggers, bolts of magic, and of course, darts are their weapons of choice, but they don't stop at mere bullseyes. A wire array of trick shots set these Warmages apart from their contemporaries, even if they lack the grand strategies or discipline of the more martial colleges.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Daggers
entries: You learn the {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Trick Shot
entries: You can curve your projectiles in mid-air to hit tricky targets. Whenever you make a ranged attack roll with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)|spell attack=r} or a weapon that has {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown}, you can add or subtract a {@dice d4} from the {@dice d20} roll (to a maximum of 20 or a minimum of 1). Increasing the {@dice d20} roll to a 20 doesn't score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. You can choose to use this feature after making the attack roll, potentially causing the attack to hit.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} and all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bullseye
entries: You can sink a shot exactly where you need to. Record the number rolled on the {@dice d20} whenever you make a ranged spell attack roll with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}. Rolls that have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} record the higher and lower {@dice d20} roll, respectively. If a {@dice d20} roll is increased or decreased using your {@subclassFeature Trick Shot|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Darts|ValdaWarmage|3} feature, use the new number. A recorded roll lasts for 1 minute. If you roll one of your recorded numbers again when making a spell attack roll with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you gain one of the following benefits of your choice.

entries.name: Extra Damage
entries: You can deal an extra {@damage 1d10} Force damage to the target.

entries.name: Recovery
entries: You regain one expended use of your {@subclassFeature Trick Shot|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Darts|ValdaWarmage|3} feature.

entries.name: Reroll
entries: You can reroll the {@dice d20} and must use the new roll. Record this new {@dice d20} roll.

subclassFeature.name: Dagger Climb
entries: You can cast {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24} to summon a pair of daggers to your open hands, helping you scale surfaces. You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Intercepting Shot
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when an attacker you can see within 60 feet makes an attack against you or an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} you can see within 30 feet of yourself, you can make a ranged spell attack using {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24} to interrupt the attack. If the result of your roll is greater than the result of the attacker, you can reduce the attack roll targeting you by 5 (to a minimum result of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Vanishing Toss
entries: You master the house's signature technique for recovering darts. Whenever you cast the {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24} cantrip, you can replace one of your spell attacks with throwing a special teleportation dagger to a point you can see within the spell's range. You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to teleport to the dagger as long as you are within 500 feet of it. The dagger disappears after 10 minutes or if you use this feature to teleport or throw another teleportation dagger.

subclassFeature.name: Dart Burst
entries: If you have recorded ten or more unique numbers using your {@subclassFeature Bullseye|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Darts|ValdaWarmage|3} feature, you can take an action to clear all of your recorded numbers and throw a burst of darts.
