Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage for each unique recorded number on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: House of Rooks
entries: {@i Practice Furtive Magic and Mystical Stealth}

The clandestine members of the House of Rooks make adept spies, assassins, and scouts, though they might just as easily pick up jobs run by rogues and brigands. In addition to their suite of cantrips, Rooks are light on their feet and know a few tricks to magically open doors in utter silence.

subclassFeature.name: Rook Strike
entries: When you make an attack roll or ability check, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll. Alternatively, you can impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on a saving throw a creature makes against a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} you cast before the end of your turn.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Acrobat
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}, or {@skill Stealth|XPHB}. Additionally, you gain a bonus equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1) to all Dexterity checks you make.

subclassFeature.name: Covert Magic
entries: You learn a suite of furtive magic practiced by Rooks. You can cast each of the following spells without using a spell slot or Verbal components: {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Knock|XPHB} (silent when you cast it using this feature), {@spell Silence|XPHB}, and {@spell Spider Climb|XPHB}.

Once you cast a spell using this feature, you can't cast it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can expend a use of {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|5} to regain your use of all of these spells (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Fleeting Decoy
entries: When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to raise a defensive illusion that protects you from further harm. Attacks made against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Elusive Step
entries: If you move more than 5 feet on your turn, any subsequent movement you make doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Assassin
entries: You can cast the {@spell Greater Invisibility|XPHB} spell targeting yourself only without a spell slot or spell components. While you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is doubled.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: House of Kings
entries: {@i Lead Your Allies with Brilliant Stratagems}

Warmages who train in the House of Kings specialize in tactics and strategy, learning age-old maneuvers to gain an edge in combat. Natural-born leaders, Kings work best with a cadre of supporters to perform their tactics and overwhelm the enemy. Moreso than all other Warmages, those in the House of Kings treat life and death as a game of strategy to be understood and conquered.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Medium armor and Shields.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Tactics
entries: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called Battle Dice.

entries.name: Battle Dice
entries: You have two Battle Dice, which are d6s. A Battle Die is expended when you use it. You regain all expended Battle Dice when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} or finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Your Battle Die changes and more Battle Dice become available when you reach certain Warmage levels as shown on the Battle Dice table.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: You can expend Battle Dice to perform maneuvers. Your maneuver options are detailed at the end of the subclass description.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If a maneuver requires a saving throw, the DC equals to your spell save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Maneuver Options
entries: The maneuvers are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Lead from the Front
entries: {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement. {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} that can see you within 120 feet of you also gain this benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Master
entries: {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} within 10 feet of you add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to their saving throws against spells and magical effects.

subclassFeature.name: Checkmate [Maneuver]
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to direct an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} within 60 feet of yourself that can see or hear you to strike. The {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast a cantrip or make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. The {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} adds the Battle Die to the attack or cantrip's damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Grandmaster
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, choose a number of {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one) within 60 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. Give each {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} a Battle Die without expending it.

Once within the next minute when the {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, it can roll the Battle Die and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20}, potentially turning the failure into a success. A Battle Die is expended when it's rolled.

subclassFeature.name: House of Roulette
entries: {@i Spin the Wheel, Gambling on Your Lucky Numbers}

Like the Houses of Dice and Cards, Warmages of the House of Roulette are masters of the calculated gamble. Bearing a number of magical chips, they can push the odds when the need arises, pulling off longshot plays that other Warmages could only dream of.

subclassFeature.name: Spin the Wheel
entries: You gain a roulette ball infused with arcane energy and a number of chips. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can conjure a roulette wheel of magical force and roll the ball. Choose one of the bets from the Roulette Bets table below, announce your guess, and roll a {@dice d100}. You gain the listed benefit if your guess is correct.

entries.name: Chips of Fate
entries: You have four Chips of Fate, and regain all expended chips when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You gain two more Chips of Fate at level 7 (6 chips), 10 (8 chips), and 15 (10 chips).

Whenever you place a bet on the roulette wheel, you can expend 1-4 of your chips to place additional bets equal to the number of chips expended. No matter how many chips you expend, you can only place two types of bets, such as Singles and Tens, per {@dice d100} roll. You can't place more than one Odd/Even or High/Low bets. You can gain two benefits at once if you win two bets on the same roll.

entries.caption: Roulette Bets
rows: {@b Odd/Even.} Guess whether the roll is even or odd.
You gain a +2 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.
{@b High/Low.} Guess whether the roll is above or below 50.
You gain a +2 bonus on attack rolls you make until the start of your next turn.
{@b Lanes.} Guess which of the following spans the number falls within: 01-20, 21-40, 41-60 , 61-80, 81-00.
You can gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} you make before the end of your next turn.
{@b Tens.} Guess the 10s digit of the roll.
Once before the end of your next turn, you can add 10 to the damage roll of a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} you cast.
{@b Single.} Guess the exact number of the roll.
Until the start of your next turn, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage and treat any d20 roll you make as 20.

subclassFeature.name: Lucky Number
entries: Pick a Lucky Number from 1 to 100 If you roll that number on any {@dice d100} roll of your {@subclassFeature Spin the Wheel|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Roulette|ValdaWarmage|3} feature, you gain the benefit of betting that number as a Single. You can change your Lucky Number whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Spinning Shield
entries: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to conjure your roulette wheel between yourself and the attacker. You and the attacker each roll a {@dice d100}. If your roll is equal or higher than that of the attacker, the attack misses, and you can't use this ability again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Cash Out
entries: You can unleash the energy stored within a Chip of Fate to escape a tight spot. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a Chip of Fate to teleport up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Everything on Black
entries: Whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you regain 4 expended Chips of Fate. Additionally, whenever you expend one or more Chips of Fate to bet on a Single and win, you regain all of your expended Chips of Fate.

subclassFeature.name: House of Cards
entries: {@i Push Your Luck With Hands of Cards}

Warmages who join the House of Cards approach combat the same way they do games of chance: with high stakes and calculated gambles. Each Warmage of this house wields a special deck of cards tied to the very threads of fate, through which they can empower their magic with deft flurries of hands. However, while these Warmages command incredible power, their magical surges are at the whims of the cards, and so they must make strategic, ingenious plays to master them.

subclassFeature.name: Bluff
entries: Your poker face carries you through practically any lie. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception|XPHB} skill and with the Gaming Kit ({@item playing cards|XPHB}), if you don't already have it. Additionally, you gain a bonus to Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) checks equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Deck of Fate
entries: You gain a deck of magical playing or tarot cards, called a Deck of Fate, through which you can enhance the power of your cantrips. Shuffle a standard 52-card playing card deck and draw a hand of five cards when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

Whenever you target an enemy with a Warmage spell that deals damage, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to play one or more cards from your hand to enhance the power of the spell. If the cards exactly match one of the results on the Hands table, the spell deals extra damage to one of its targets of your choice or grants you one additional effect, according to the result. If the cards don't match a result, they have no effect. Aces count as ones for results. Once you play a card, place it on the bottom of your deck and draw until you have five cards in your hand again.

entries.caption: Hands
rows: Any five sequential cards, regardless of suit.
Any five cards of the same suit, regardless of order.
Any three of the same rank.
Any two of the same rank.
You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.
You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: High Stakes
entries: On your turn, you can choose any number of cards from your hand and place them on the bottom of your {@subclassFeature Deck of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Cards|ValdaWarmage|3} (no action required), losing 2 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} per card you choose. You then draw until you have five cards in your hand again.

subclassFeature.name: Dealer's Choice
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to gain one of the following effects, chosen by the GM.

entries.name: Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Teleportation
entries: You teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of you.

entries.name: Demiplane
entries: You vanish into a safe, endless demiplane. At the start of your next turn, you reappear in the space you left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Card Reading
entries: Once on each of your turns when you draw a card from your deck as part of your {@subclassFeature Deck of Fate|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|Cards|ValdaWarmage|3} feature, you can declare a suit (Clubs, Diamonds, Hearts, or Spades) and check the top card of your deck. If you guessed the suit correctly, you can take the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or Use an {@variantrule Object|XPHB} action as part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} used for the feature.

subclassFeature.name: Ace in the Hole
entries: Whenever you would draw one or more cards from your deck, draw twice as many. Put half of the cards drawn on the bottom of your deck and the other cards in your hand.

subclassFeature.name: House of Bishops
entries: {@i Wield Greater Arcane Magic}

The House of Bishops adopts Warmages with arcane potential and teaches its members traditional spellcasting. Such Warmages might be mistaken for Wizards or Sorcerers, for they wield many of the same spells, but bishops prioritize excellence in their spellcasting over a wide repertoire of spells.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You gain the ability to cast more potent spells.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Bishop Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three level 1 spells from the Wizard spell list. {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB}, {@spell Grease|XPHB}, and {@spell Shield|XPHB} are recommended. The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Warmage levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Bishop Spellcasting table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Wizard spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 7 Warmage, your list of prepared spells can include five Wizard spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.
Changing your Prepared Spells. Whenever you gain a Warmage level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Wizard spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Warmage Edge
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Warmage Edge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|1} feature to improve the damage rolls of level 1+ Wizard spells as if they were cantrips. If you add {@classFeature Warmage Edge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|1} to the {@spell Magic Missile|XPHB} spell, you improve the damage roll of only one dart.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Study
entries: You gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Medicine|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Companion
entries: You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared, which doesn't count against your number of prepared spells. When you cast the spell, you choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature Imp|XMM}, {@creature Pseudodragon|XMM}, {@creature Quasit|XMM}, or {@creature Sprite|XMM}.

subclassFeature.name: Siege Casting
entries: Your Warmage and Wizard spells deal double damage to objects and structures. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on spell attack rolls against targets that are 100 or more feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Sculpting
entries: When you cast a spell with a spell slot that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one). The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Dominance
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a number of spell slots with a combined level of 6+ to regain one expended use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|5}.

subclassFeature.name: Black Rider
entries: {@i Command and Battle Atop a Skeletal Steed}

The rhythmic drumbeat of galloping hooves and the searing pinpoints of red eyes signal the arrival of a Black Rider. Such Necromancers embrace mounted combat, commanding their thralls from the back of a skeletal steed and terrorizing countrysides with unparalleled swiftness. Mastering this discipline means not only commanding an Undead mount, but also requires sure mastery over weapons while on horseback and on foot. However, the reward is immense: a Black Rider isn't a plodding marshal of shambling masses, but a wind of death that blows across the battlefield at a moment's notice.

subclassFeature.name: Corpse Cavalry
entries: Your training for mounted combat grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Light armor, Medium armor, and Shields.

entries.name: Charnel Strike
entries: When you use {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you can make a melee attack with a weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn.

entries.name: Skeletal Mount
entries: Additionally, when you perform your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2|ValdaNecromancer|Animate Thralls} ritual, you can animate the skeleton of a horse or similar animal as a {@creature Warhorse Skeleton|XMM}. In combat, it functions as a controlled mount while you ride it (as defined in the rules on mounted combat).

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Shield
entries: When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend a number of points from your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} pool up to half the damage dealt. Reduce the damage by the number of points expended.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.
In addition, you can use your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} or cast one of your cantrips that has a casting time of an action in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Gruesome Charge
entries: If you make an attack with a weapon while mounted, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command your mount to make one attack of its own with its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. You can only use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} if your mount has moved 20 feet or further on the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Dullahan [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. Through a vile ritual and a guillotine, you have severed your own head to act as your spirit jar, allowing you to see without eyes. Liches of your kind are known as dullahans or headless horsemen. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Skull Jar
entries: Your spirit jar is your own magically preserved head. Even without your head, your senses aren't inhibited. You can see and hear from where your head once was and your disembodied voice booms from the stub of your neck.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: If you are carrying your skull jar, you have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

entries.name: Nightmare
entries: When you perform your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2|ValdaNecromancer|Animate Thralls} ritual, you can summon a {@creature Nightmare|XMM}. You command this creature as your thrall and it counts as Undead for the purpose of your Necromancer features. In combat, it functions as an independent mount while you ride it (as defined in the rules on mounted combat).

subclassFeature.name: Plague Lord
entries: {@i Harness the Vile Power of Sickness and Rot}

If elemental Necromancy thrives anywhere on the Material Plane, it is perhaps at a miniscule size of a bacterium. There, the greatest of plagues are born to ravage entire kingdoms and continents with inexorable sickness. Necromancers that seeks to harness this form of Necromancy are known as Plague Lords, commanders of vermin and disease alike.

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Toxin
entries: When you deal 5 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Necrotoxin
entries: When you cast a Necromancer spell or use a Necromancer feature that deals Poison damage or gives the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, it ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Vile Congregation
entries: Leagues of vermin cling to your skin and swarm over others nearby. Whenever an enemy within 5 feet of you makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} you can subtract {@dice 1d4} from the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Projectile Spew
entries: Your reach with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} and spells with a range of Touch is 10 feet greater than normal, as magically imbued projectile vomit delivers the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Bloated Thralls
entries: When one of your thralls is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or you release it, you can cause it to explode in a shower of toxic gore. Each creature you choose within 5 feet of the thrall makes a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much Poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Corpulent Lich [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. Your obsession with disease and rot has affected your transformation: you bloat like a waterlogged corpse and your skin turns a sickly green. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Gore Burst
entries: When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, your body explodes in a shower of necromantic energy.

Each creature you choose within 20 feet of you makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Necromancer spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d10} Poison damage and {@damage 5d10} Necrotic damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entries.name: Master of Disease
entries: When you deal 25 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition and is cursed for 1 minute. Choose two of the following effects which afflict the target while it is cursed. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, ending the curse and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on a success.

entries.name: Bleeding
entries: Each time the target takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage

entries.name: Disadvantage
entries: Choose one ability. The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability.

entries.name: Garbled
entries: The target can't speak coherently or cast spells with a Verbal component.

entries.name: Red-Eye
entries: The target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition beyond 10 feet.

entries.name: Unsteady
entries: The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition at the end of each of its turns.

subclassFeature.name: Reanimator
entries: {@i Stitch Together Terrible Minions}

Through bubbling test tubes and sparking electrodes, you have discovered the true heart of Necromancy: mad science. You've experimented in far-reaching disciplines of surgery, alchemy, and physics, using your animated minions as gruesome test subjects and walking surgical dummies. Most crucially, you have discovered that lightning can imbue almost anything with a semblance of life, from the smallest severed muscle to the most towering golems.

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Surgeon
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine|XPHB} skill, if you didn't already have it. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Spell-Stitching
entries: You can inscribe magical effects into your thralls with gruesome Spell-Stitches. You can expend {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} Points to apply Spell-Stitches to your thralls over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. The number of Charnel Touch points required to apply each stitch is listed in parentheses. Each thrall can have a maximum of two stitches, which last until the thrall dies or you apply a new stitch to replace it.

entries.name: Armored Stitch (15 Charnel Touch Points)
entries: The thrall's AC becomes 18 if it were lower.

entries.name: Fleet Stitch (5 Charnel Touch Points)
entries: The thrall's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is doubled.

entries.name: Skilled Stitch (5 Charnel Touch Points)
entries: The thrall has proficiency in all of your skills.

entries.name: Tough Stitch (10 Charnel Touch Points)
entries: The thrall's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum and current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} increase by twice your Necromancer level.

entries.name: Vicious Stitch (10 Charnel Touch Points)
entries: The thrall has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack roll it makes on each of its turns.

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Voltage
entries: When you deal 5 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you can deal Lightning damage instead of Necrotic damage and cause the energy to arc to a second creature within 5 feet of the target. The second creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take Lightning damage equal to half of the number of Charnel Touch points expended. A creature that takes Lightning damage from this feature can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Lazarus Bolt
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can drive a bolt into the torso of a creature within 5 feet of you that has died within the last minute and shock it back to life. That creature revives with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. This feature can't return to life a creature that lacks a heart, a creature that has died of old age, or a creature that is missing vital organs.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending 20 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Quick Stitch
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can apply a {@subclassFeature Spell-Stitch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|Reanimator|ValdaNecromancer|3} to one of your thralls, expending {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points as normal. This stitch lasts for 10 minutes and can exceed the thrall's maximum of two stitches.

subclassFeature.name: Patchwork Golem [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. Through abominable works of alchemy and surgery, you have constructed an artificial body to act as the vessel for your soul. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Golem Body
entries: Your soul jar is your artificial golem body. It has a specific weakness, which you must discuss with your GM. Your rejuvenation is only stopped when your body is completely destroyed using its weakness. When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you temporarily die and reanimate with half of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} after 1 hour.

entries.name: Gruesome Physicality
entries: Your Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores become 20 if they weren't already higher.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

entries.name: Self-Stitches
entries: You can apply any number of Spell- Stiches to yourself as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, expending {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points as normal. {@subclassFeature Spell-Stitch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|Reanimator|ValdaNecromancer|3|ValdaNecromancer|Spell-Stitches} applied in this way last until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Toymaker
entries: {@i Trap Souls Within Handmade Toys}

Toymaking is not unlike Necromancy. Painting details in miniature, carving faces, stitching clothing, and stringing up limbs require a meticulousness and obsession also well-suited to animating the dead. Necromancers, after all, devise their own playthings and meticulously fashion them, albeit using more gruesome materials. It should come at no surprise, therefore, that Necromancy enjoys a strong tradition of toymaking. Practiced necromantic Toymakers can animate their dolls as slaymates, adorable but lethal minions that strike in overwhelming numbers.

subclassFeature.name: Slaymates
entries: You can bind the souls of the dead into Construct vessels—porcelain dolls, clockwork toys, wooden puppets, and stuffed animals. When you perform your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2|ValdaNecromancer|Animate Thralls} ritual, you can create one or more {@creature Slaymate|ValdaNecromancer|Slaymates}. You command these creatures as your thralls and they count as Undead for the purpose of your Necromancer features. Additionally, two slaymates count as one thrall for the number of thralls you can control and the number of Undead you can store in your {@classFeature Dead Space|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2}.

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Puppet
entries: You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 5 or more {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to animate two {@creature Slaymate|ValdaNecromancer|Slaymates} under your control for every 5 points expended, which count as your thralls. These slaymates appear within your space or in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Doll
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you dies, you can capture the creature's soul and trap it within a Soul Doll. The creature controls the body of the doll using the statistics of a {@creature Slaymate|ValdaNecromancer}, but it can't attack and retains its alignment, personality, languages, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.

You don't control the Soul Doll and it doesn't count as one of your thralls. It is under no compulsion to cooperate with you, especially if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy.

While the creature's soul is trapped in a Soul Doll, it can't return to life. The soul leaves the doll when the Soul Doll is reduced to {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when you release it as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. You can have up to five Soul Dolls at one time. If you attempt to create a new Soul Doll, you can release another doll as a part of the {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} used to create the new doll.

subclassFeature.name: Miniature Minions
entries: When you perform your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2|ValdaNecromancer|Animate Thralls} ritual, you can choose for any thrall you create to be Tiny and have a toylike appearance of your choice. A Tiny thrall has a +3 bonus to AC.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Lich [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. As part of the Rite, you transfer your soul into a body of ticking clockwork, a stuttering but immortal form. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Clockwork Body
entries: Your soul is bound to a Construct body with your statistics. Your type is Construct, instead of Undead.

entries.name: Clockwork Immunities
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Spell Immunities
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to three spells of your choice, which you select when you build the clockwork body.

entries.name: Backup Body
entries: You can spend 10 days and materials worth 1,000+ GP to build an additional clockwork body to act as a safeguard against death. Whenever you die, your soul transfers to another clockwork body of your choice that you have built. If you have no clockwork bodies available, you reform at your soul jar in the body of a {@creature Slaymate|ValdaNecromancer}, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, and the ability to build a clockwork body.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Ascendent
entries: {@i Command the Powers of Vampirism}

Necromantic might comes in many forms, but a singular, ancient source is the blood curse of vampirism. Though it promises much—immortality, agility, charm—it comes paired with insidious drawbacks, from the stinging burn of sunlight to a perpetual thirst for blood. Necromancers that wish to capture a measure of this power without suffering its myriad weaknesses perform a special ritual with vampiric blood in order to become Blood Ascendants. In doing so, they fall deathly pale and lose their reflection within mirrors, but learn to slowly pry out vampiric powers without succumbing to the all-devouring curse.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Ascendant Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Blood Ascendent Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Blood Ascendent Spells
rows: {@spell Phantasmal Killer|XPHB}, {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|XPHB|Private Sanctum}

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Drain
entries: When you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Necromancer level (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Vampiric Transformation
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 15 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to shape-shift into a bat or a cloud of mist. This transformation lasts for 1 hour or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or you dismiss it (no action required). Your gear melds into the new form, and you can't use or otherwise benefit from your equipment while shape-shifted.

entries.name: Bat
entries: You transform into a bat. Your game statistics are replaced by the {@creature Bat|XMM} stat block, but you retain your creature type, {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, class features, languages, and feats.

entries.name: Mist
entries: You transform into a Medium cloud of mist. While shape-shifted, you can't speak, manipulate objects, or take any actions. You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 20 feet and can hover, and can enter and occupy the space of another creature. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage, {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, and {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. You can pass through narrow openings, but treat liquid as though they were solid surfaces.

subclassFeature.name: Children of the Night
entries: When you perform your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2|ValdaNecromancer|Animate Thralls} ritual, you can summon one or more {@creature Wolf|XMM|Wolves}, {@creature Swarm of Bats|XMM|Swarms of Bats}, or {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM|Swarms of Rats}. You command these creatures as your thralls and they count as Undead for the purpose of your Necromancer features.

subclassFeature.name: Nosferatu [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. You have embraced the blood curse of vampirism to become a vampire lord in all but name: a nosferatu. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Coffin Jar
entries: Your spirit jar is a coffin filled with grave dirt. When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you reform in your coffin after 1 hour. You are permanently weakened until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in the coffin. While weakened, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced to 1, and you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} if you begin your turn in sunlight.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or are in sunlight.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries: You can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, you gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your speed.

entries.name: Vampiric Speed
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Corpse Florist
entries: {@i Cultivate a Garden of Corpses}

Some Necromancers arrive at the realization that Necromancy is the gateway to new life flourishing in the rot and waste of the recently dead. Perhaps unsurprisingly, horticulture is their main inspiration.

Instead of animating corpses normally, Corpse Florists plant seeds of the corpse flower in recently deceased bodies, which sprouts and sends creeping vines to every joint and muscle group. Within minutes, the corpse rises under the florist's control, but as a blossoming Plant instead of a mindless Undead. A Corpse Florist travels with their shambling garden wherever they go, planting new corpse flowers and revitalizing the earth whenever the opportunity presents itself.

subclassFeature.name: Corpse Florist Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Corpse Florist Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Corpse Florist Spells
rows: {@spell Barkskin|XPHB}, {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Goodberry|XPHB}, {@spell Spike Growth|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Garden of the Grave
entries: When you perform your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2|ValdaNecromancer|Animate Thralls} ritual, you can choose to plant corpse flowers in any of your thralls, causing each such thrall to have the following benefits.

entries.name: Plant
entries: The thrall is a Plant instead of an Undead, but counts as Undead for the purpose of your Necromancer features.

entries.name: Necrosynthesis
entries: Whenever you take a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, the thrall takes root in the ground and regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Entangle
entries: When you deal 5 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn as weeds and brambles grasp at it.

subclassFeature.name: Rotten Seed
entries: You can plant your budding corpse flowers in the living as well as the dead. You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to toss a seed at an enemy that you can see within 15 feet of you, which makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a corpse flower seedling sprouts and burrows into the creature's flesh. At the start of each of the creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.
The seedling withers and dies after 1 minute, when the target dies, or when you use this feature again.
The damage of this feature changes when you reach level 11 ({@dice 1d10}) and 17 ({@dice 1d12}).

subclassFeature.name: Death in Bloom
entries: Once on each of your turns when a Medium or Small creature under the effect of your Rotten Seed dies, you can animate that creature's corpse as a {@creature Skeleton|ValdaNecromancer}, {@creature Spirit|ValdaNecromancer}, or {@creature Zombie|ValdaNecromancer} (your choice) under your control. This Undead counts as one of your thralls and gains the benefit of your Garden of the Grave.

subclassFeature.name: Botanical Lich [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. Your body becomes a fertile garden of flowers that bloom from every inch of your skin, and exotic flowers bloom in your wake. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Spirit Flowers
entries: Your spirit jar is a set of thirteen immortal flowers of different types located in places important to you. Each one has a specific weakness, which you must discuss with your GM. When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you reform in the soil at your nearest spirit flower.

entries.name: Petal Stride
entries: Flowers sprout from the ground in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to step into a flower and teleport to any other flower you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, you can choose any number of friendly Plants within 30 feet of you and cause them to teleport to flowers you can see within range.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or you are in {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Crone
entries: {@i Brew Foul Potions and Lay Fouler Curses}

The oldest and most insidious necromantic secrets are remembered by hag's covens. Their curses have plagued the likes of elves and humans since before the dawn of history, becoming more malicious and complex with the passing centuries.

Necromancers that consort with hags or join a hag's coven to learn their necromantic secrets are known as "crones" by their peers and "haglings" by others. For their devotion to the hag's ancient arts, these Necromancers learn to spin terrible curses, brew potions in a cauldron, and even access the mythical Baba Yaga's arcane secrets.

subclassFeature.name: Crone Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Crone Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Crone Spells
rows: {@spell Blindness/Deafness|XPHB}, {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Curse
entries: When you deal 5 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be cursed. While cursed, the target subtracts {@dice 1d6} from {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} it makes. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Wisdom saving throw against the curse, ending the effect on a success. The curse lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature to curse another creature or choose to dismiss it (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Witch's Cauldron
entries: You can spend 10 minutes to brew potions, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, expending 10 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points for each potion you brew. You can have a total number of potions at one time up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). These potions retain potency until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, after which they become inert.

The following potions are available to you: {@item Potion of Animal Friendship|XDMG}, {@item Potion of Climbing|XDMG}, {@item Potion of Healing|XDMG}, {@item Potion of Resistance|XDMG}, and {@item Potion of Water Breathing|XDMG}.

subclassFeature.name: Nefarious Ruse
entries: You master a handful of hag tricks, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Conceal Thralls
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend 10 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to give your thralls the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. This condition ends early for a thrall that makes an attack roll or deals damage.

entries.name: Thrall Transposition
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose one of your thralls within 30 feet of you. You both teleport, swapping places.

subclassFeature.name: Baba Yaga [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. By mastering the subtle magic of hags and witches, you can wield the full power of a coven and curse others with unparalleled foulness. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Accursed Touch
entries: When you deal 25 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws until the start of your next turn, and your thralls have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against the target.

entries.name: Flying Broom
entries: You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to enchant a mundane object—such as a broom, cauldron, or rug—with the power of flight. While holding this item, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to 60 feet, as long as you aren't wearing Medium or Heavy armor. This object remains enchanted until you use this benefit to enchant a different object.

entries.name: Baba Yaga Spells
entries: You can expend {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to cast one of the spells from the following table without a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Dead Mist Acolyte
entries: {@i Sacrifice Your Life-Force for Necromantic Power}

Deep in the starry expanse of the Astral Plane, Necromancers can find a pure, untapped necromantic source: the Dead Mists. This inky astral fog is an embodiment of unlife in the multiverse, perhaps a negative balance to the overwhelming majority of living creatures. However, the Dead Mists is a living and corruptive entity that drains the life essence from anything it touches.

Necromancers that survive their first experimentations in the Dead Mists might become its acolytes and spend their waking hours unraveling its astral secrets. Perhaps they will learn to coax life essence back out of the necromantic cloud, or perhaps they will learn to summon aspects of the mists to plague their foes. Regardless, they will pay the price for their ambitions as the mists slowly drain their mortality.

subclassFeature.name: Dead Mist Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Dead Mist Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Dead Mist Spells
rows: {@spell Dead Mist Lash|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, {@spell Levitate|XPHB}, {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Consumption
entries: When you deal 5 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you can instead choose to lose an equal number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} instead of expending Charnel Touch Points.
Because of the soul-draining nature of the Dead Mists, you can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from any spell you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Mistborne Regeneration
entries: You can restore your life essence by feeding upon the Dead Mists. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend 5 or more {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points. You regain {@dice 1d8} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} for every 5 Charnel Touch points expended.

subclassFeature.name: Gaseous Escape
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you take damage, you can cast {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB} on yourself. The spell's effects apply against the triggering damage. When you cast the spell with this feature, you can end it at the start of your turn (no action required).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Duskfog
entries: When you perform your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2|ValdaNecromancer|Animate Thralls} ritual, you can summon one or more {@creature Duskfog|ValdaNecromancer|Duskfogs}. You command these creatures as your thralls.

subclassFeature.name: Dead Mist Lord [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. However, your lichdom has become corrupted by the all-consuming Dead Mists, leaving you as a gaseous, incorporeal wraith. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

entries.name: Gaseous Body
entries: Your lich form is gaseous and indistinct. You can enter and occupy the spaces of other creatures. Additionally, you can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though you treat liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

entries.name: Fly Speed
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. You can't fall and remain hovering in the air even when you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} or {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Master of the Mists
entries: Once on each of your turns when you deal Necrotic damage to an enemy with your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} or a Necromancer spell, you drain some of the target's life essence with the Dead Mists. You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Intelligence modifier, up to a maximum of the Necrotic damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Overlord
entries: {@i Command an Army of Obedient Undead}

There are few ambitions that capture the imagination more than the power to rule. From peasantry to nobility, many dream of a world in which they are in charge. Some Necromancers, known as Overlords, view their magic as a means to accomplish this pervasive dream. Seeking control both on and off the battlefield, Overlords leverage their dark magic to bolster their allies and manipulate their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Overlord Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Overlord Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Overlord Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Aura
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 5 or more {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to create an empowering aura in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you until the start of your next turn. Undead you control within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} gain a bonus to {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}, damage rolls, and AC. This bonus equals +1 for every 5 Charnel Touch points expended, to a maximum of +3.

subclassFeature.name: Despotic Discourse
entries: You gain a bonus to Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, and {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) checks equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Thralls
entries: When you're hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force that attack to instead hit one of your thralls that is within 5 feet of you.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Tyrant [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. Your desire for control has warped your transformation, transforming you into a tyrant lich. Your flesh and bone decay, reducing you to nothing more than two glowing dots beneath a hood. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Possession
entries: If you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can choose to possess a nearby body instead of reforming at your spirit jar. When you do so, choose a Humanoid or one of your thralls within 120 feet of yourself. A Humanoid must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or be possessed.

When you possess a body, you control it, but a Humanoid target retains awareness. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the body, though you retain your alignment and your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You retain your own class features and feats. If the target has any class levels, you can't use any of its class features.

A possessed Humanoid can repeat its saving throw every 8 hours. On a success, the possession ends and you are ejected from the body. The possession also ends if the body drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or you choose to end it as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. A creature that succeeds its saving throw against your possession is immune to your {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} for 24 hours.

entries.name: Domination Spells
entries: You can expend Charnel Touch points to cast one of the spells from the following table without a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Pale Master
entries: {@i Achieve the Archetypal Powers of Lichdom}

When the need for superiority drives a Necromancer, there is no end to their ambition. Such Necromancers, known as Pale Masters, work feverishly to master every corner of necromantic magic, less out of the desire to improve themselves and more out of spite for their rivals.

This perhaps speaks to a dirty secret of Necromancy: most Necromancers hate each other. Bitter rivalries, grudges, and insignificant slights motivate Pale Masters to embrace lichdom with unequaled fervor, for to master Necromancy means to accept no equals.

subclassFeature.name: Pale Master Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Pale Master Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Pale Master Spells
rows: {@spell Exhume|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Might of the Abyss|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Empower
entries: When you deal damage with a level 1+ Necromancy spell, you can expend a number of {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points up to a maximum of your Necromancer level plus your Intelligence modifier. One target of the spell takes extra Necrotic damage equal to the number of Charnel Touch points expended.

subclassFeature.name: Chilling Disposition
entries: You begin assuming the terrible aspect of a lich, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Intelligent Intimidation
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} skill, if you didn't have it already. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Frightening Gaze
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 10 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to fix your horrific gaze on a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Thrall Rush
entries: Whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can empty the contents of your {@classFeature Dead Space|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2} and each of your thralls can move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Archlich [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. Your skin clings tightly to your bones, your muscles wither, and your eyes turn milky and dull. Yet, through the veil of weakness, your body exudes unbelievable arcane power. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Devour Soul
entries: When you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can immediately devour its soul (no action required). Roll a {@dice d8} and regain expended spell slots of your choice whose combined level is no greater than the number rolled. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
A creature whose soul is devoured can't be restored to life by any means short of a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: When you deal 30 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Pharaoh
entries: {@i Embrace Pseudo-Divinity}

The godlike monarchs of ancient kingdoms practiced a unique style of Necromancy, forgotten to time. Through the extraction of organs, the desiccation of flesh, and innumerable enchantments, those ancient pharaohs were able to rule their subjects as divine, Undead beings, long past their mortal deaths. While those kingdoms have been lost to the shifting sands and wild jungles of the world, their methods have been preserved in the carvings of colossal temples and revived by modern Necromancers, who take on the guise of the erstwhile pharaohs. Their magic is a hybrid of divine and arcane influences, the legacy of deific monarchs from a forgotten age.

subclassFeature.name: Pharaoh Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Pharaoh Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Pharaoh Spells
rows: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Darkness|XPHB}, {@spell Guiding Bolt|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Holy Symbol
entries: You can use a {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Necromancer spells.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You can channel your pseudo-divinity to fuel magical effects. You start with one such effect: Ankh of Radiance, which is described below. You gain additional effect options at higher Necromancer levels. Each time you use this class's Channel Divinity, choose which Channel Divinity effect from this class to create.

You can use this class's Channel Divinity twice. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore one use of it by expending 15 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points (no action required).

entries.name: Ankh of Radiance
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can brandish your Holy Symbol and bless a number of allies up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one) that you can see within 60 feet of you for 1 minute. The first time a blessed creature takes damage, it has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage. If it took damage from a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage. The blessing then ends for that creature.
The Radiant damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach Necromancer levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

subclassFeature.name: Mock Divinity
entries: You can convincingly reflect the trappings of a demigod walking the earth. When you cast {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB}, you can use any number of its effects. Additionally, you can create the following effects.

entries.name: Avatar
entries: At a point within range, you manifest a Huge illusory avatar for 1 minute. You determine the avatar's appearance. It mimics your movements and projects your speech in a booming voice.

entries.name: Gathering Storm
entries: Clouds gather and churn overhead for 1 minute. You determine the appearance of the clouds and whether they are accompanied by thunder, lightning, or a light rain.

entries.name: Sun and Moon
entries: You can brighten or darken the sun or moon for 1 minute. Within range, you can change {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} to {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} to {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}, or vice versa.

subclassFeature.name: Scarab of Judgement
entries: You can expend a use of your {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|Pharaoh|ValdaNecromancer|3} to transfer life from the Undead to the living. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch one of your thralls and choose a willing Humanoid you can see within 60 feet of you. The Undead is destroyed and reduced to dust, and the Humanoid regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Undead's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Once a creature regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mummy Lord [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. This entails undergoing the ancient funeral rites of the pharaohs, removing your organs and entombing your body in a sarcophagus amongst your worldly possessions. You become the oldest and most exalted type of lich: a mummy lord. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Canopic Jars
entries: Your spirit jar is a set of four canopic jars containing your stomach, lungs, intestines, and liver. Each one has a specific weakness, which you must discuss with your GM. Your rejuvenation is only stopped when all four canopic jars are destroyed. When you are destroyed, you reform at your sarcophagus.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Mummy Rot
entries: When you deal 20 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target is cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, and its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by {@dice 3d6} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this attack.

entries.name: Whirlwind of Sand
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can transform into a whirlwind of sand, move up to 60 feet, and revert to your normal form. While in whirlwind form, you are Immune to all damage and to the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, {@condition Prone|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions. Equipment you are wearing or carrying remains in your possession.

subclassFeature.name: Reaper
entries: {@i Become One with the Shadows}

The oblivion of death is the wellspring Necromancy, a dark abyss into which all Necromancers stare. Those few Necromancers who forsake their souls outright might become Reapers, figures of shadow and demise that beckon others to the afterlife. For performing this deed, they strengthen their connection to that distant oblivion until they are but tenebrous shadows: harbingers of an inevitable end.

subclassFeature.name: Reaper Spells
entries: Your necromantic ambitions ensure you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Necromancer level specified in the Reaper Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Reaper Spells
rows: {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Silence|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Veil
entries: When you deal 5 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Form
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can flatten your body into a shadow upon the floor. You remain in Umbral Form until you end this effect as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. While in Umbral Form, the following rules apply.

entries.name: Inactive
entries: You can't take any action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, other than to leave the form.

entries.name: Immunities
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} and {@condition Prone|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Difficult Target
entries: Attacks against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Invisible in Darkness
entries: While entirely in {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition to any creature that relies on {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} to see you in that {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} doubles and you gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. You can move across difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. As a shadow, you can only move along surfaces; you can't jump or fly.

entries.name: Gear
entries: Your equipment merges with your Umbral Form and has no effect until you leave the form.

subclassFeature.name: Wraith Flight
entries: Each of your thralls gains a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. If it already has a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB}, its {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} is doubled. Additionally, your thralls don't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} while flying.

subclassFeature.name: Harbinger [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. You have become an embodiment of death itself. Clad in shadows, you seem little more than a skeletal presence in a foreboding robe, a sight that all people fear to behold. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Death's Touch
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} and roll an 11 or higher on the {@dice d20} for the attack roll, you hit the target, regardless of its AC.

entries.name: Fell Flight
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Grim Harvest
entries: When you kill a Medium or Small creature that isn't Undead using {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you rip its soul from its body, which animates as a {@creature Specter|XMM} under your control and counts as one of your thrall.

subclassFeature.name: Death Knight
entries: {@i Crush Your Foes with Your Iron Fist}

Some Necromancers are content to sit in dusty tombs with moldering tomes, occasionally picking apart a battlefield for fresh ingredients and new company. By contrast, Death Knights are predators among scavengers, seizing their goals through a melding of magic and traditional combat. Bolstered with dark energies and sturdy armor, the Death Knight wields weapons edged with death itself. They are simultaneously the vanguard and general of their Undead forces, unafraid of getting their hands dirty when necessary.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Research
entries: Your training in the art of war grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Light armor, Medium armor, and Shields.

entries.name: Charnel Strike
entries: When you use {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you can make a melee attack with a weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn.

entries.name: Somatic Components
entries: You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a Shield in one or both hands.

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Resilience
entries: When you deal Necrotic damage with your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.
In addition, you can use your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} or cast one of your cantrips that has a casting time of an action in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Overcharged Thralls
entries: When one of your thralls is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or you release it, you regain a number of expended {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points equal to your Necromancer level.

subclassFeature.name: Imperator [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. Due to your martial capabilities and inner nexus of necromantic power, you have transformed into an imperator lich—an Undead creature unmatched in both arcane and combat prowess. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Heavy Armor Training
entries: You gain training with Heavy Armor.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

entries.name: Improved Charnel Strike
entries: When you use {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, you can make two melee attacks with a weapon as a Bonus action later on the same turn.

entries.name: Peerless Necrotic Damage
entries: When you deal Necrotic damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} or a Necromancer spell, it ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Necrodancer
entries: {@i Groove Down}

Neon lights, thumping beats, and impeccable fashion are the calling cards of Necrodancers, spellcasters that see the potential for {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} to create the greatest troupe of backup dancers of all time. A Necrodancer's minions don't shamble aimlessly, but instead move in perfect rhythm with one another, busting moves and empowering their master through choreography.

subclassFeature.name: Footloose
entries: Your necromantic dancing grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Intelligent Footwork
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} and {@skill Performance|XPHB} skills if you lack proficiency in them. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using these skills equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Weapon Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons that have the Finesse or Ranged properties.

subclassFeature.name: Backup Dancers
entries: Each of your thralls gains the ability to take the Dance action, which allows it to dance until the start of its next turn. When one or more of your thralls are dancing, your dancers give you a bonus to your AC, damage rolls, and {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} that use Dexterity or Charisma, as shown on the Backup Dancers table. You also gain a number of benefits as shown in the Benefits column of the Backup Dancers table.

entries.caption: Backup Dancers
rows: {@b Disengage.} You can take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
{@b Dash.} You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
{@b Strike.} You can make one attack with a Melee weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

{@b Two Bonus Actions.} You can take two {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB|Bonus Actions} on your turn instead of one, as long as both {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB|Bonus Actions} are different and granted to you by this subclass.

{@b Evasion.} When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Slippery.} Attack rolls against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Charnel Groove
entries: When you deal 5 or more damage with {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1}, the target is compelled to dance, spending all of its movement to do so without leaving its space, until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Graveyard Tango
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 5 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to bestow your grace and style on an ally. Choose an ally within 30 feet of yourself that can see or hear you to gain the bonus to AC, damage rolls, and {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} that use Dexterity or Charisma from your {@subclassFeature Backup Dancers|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|Necrodancer|ValdaNecromancer|3} feature until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Disco of the Dead
entries: Whenever one of your thralls takes the Dance action, you can choose for it to enter the Ethereal Plane until the start of its next turn. While on the Ethereal Plane, it can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. An ethereal thrall is faintly visible in a blur of disco lights.

subclassFeature.name: Thriller [Lichdom]
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of Necromancy and transformed yourself into a lich. You appear ageless, with smooth, alabaster skin, and boast supernatural grace and rhythm. You gain the following benefits in addition to those of your {@classFeature Lichdom|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|20} feature.

entries.name: Dance-Off
entries: You take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 20 {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} points to magically challenge up to ten creatures you can see within 60 feet of you to a dance competition. Each creature you challenge makes a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 8d6} Psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Moonwalk
entries: You can cast {@spell Freedom of Movement|XPHB} on your thralls or yourself without a spell slot.

entries.name: Smooth Criminal
entries: Your Dexterity and Charisma scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 25.

subclassFeature.name: Time Operative
entries: {@i Manipulate Time to Solve Mysteries}

Time Operatives are agents from the future bestowed with a series of cryptic goals and a well of chronomantic magic. Some operatives hail from far-off utopias or crumbling apocalypses, while others simply receive a message across space and time and dedicate themselves to its mission. To prevent paradoxes, these Time Operatives receive only the barest clues pertaining to their mission. They know only the gravity of the situation, and that it is inherent upon them to change the course of history.

subclassFeature.name: Borrowed Time
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can take an additional action. This action can only be used to take only the {@action Attack|XPHB} (one attack only), {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.
You can use this feature twice, and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Blank Tablet
