entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you touch a creature and end one condition on it: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}. You can't remove a condition that a creature has had for longer than 1 minute.

entries.name: Quicksilver Emblem
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Longstrider|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Weightless Sphere
entries: You can cast {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Rewind
entries: When you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and fail, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to rewind time to the moment before the attempt. Reroll the {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and you must use the new roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Echo of Yesterday
entries: You can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast your senses up to 24 hours back in time at your current location. You can see and hear this location as if you were there, but the past appears dreamlike and shadowy. While perceiving the past, you can look in any direction, but you can't move or speak. This glimpse into the past lasts for 10 minutes, but it ends early if you dismiss it (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Steal Time
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} or reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain a use of your {@subclassFeature Borrowed Time|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|Time Operative|ValdaInvestigator|3}.

subclassFeature.name: Spy
entries: {@i Infiltrate, Assassinate, and Lie with Aplomb}

Infiltration, disguise, and lying through their teeth: these are the principal skills of a Spy. A talented Spy rarely needs to draw a dagger to silence someone, for their honeyed words and agreeable disposition are all that is needed to draw out someone's secrets. Of course, when they do strike, it is decisive and without warning. Such skills are invaluable for governments and organizations of all types, used for stealing confidential information, sabotage, monitoring persons of interest, and everything in between.

subclassFeature.name: Bravado
entries: Your infectious confidence gives you a bonus to your Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB} and {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) checks equal to our Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Glass Dust
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can throw this pouch at a point you can see within 10 feet of you, filling a 5-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point with glittering dust until the start of your next turn. A creature that enters the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there has the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. This condition ends early for a creature that leaves the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}, makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

entries.name: Horn-Rimmed Glasses
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Martini Glass
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Charm Person|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Cloak and Dagger
entries: When you deal damage during the first round of combat, you can deal extra Force damage to the target if the target hasn't taken a turn yet or if you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll against the target. The Force damage equals your Investigator level.

subclassFeature.name: Body Double
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can assume the identity of a Humanoid or a corpse of a Humanoid that you touch that has been dead for no longer than 24 hours. An illusion causes your appearance to perfectly match the target, including clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings. If the target is a corpse, you resemble the Humanoid as it appeared in life. Additionally, the corpse, its blood, clothing, and other physical evidence of its death, become magically {@condition invisible} for 8 hours.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the {@action Study|XPHB} action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Glib
entries: You can cast {@spell Glibness|XPHB} without a Material component. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. For the spell's duration, you can take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Medium
entries: {@i Foretell the Future and Commune with the Dead}

As conduits between the living and dead, Mediums offer an essential glimpse past the veil of mortality. Using their auguries, seances, and divinations, Mediums can retrieve morsels of information from the afterlife to settle debts between the living or dead, and to assist ongoing investigations. This information, however cryptic, can point an interested party toward clues or evidence that only the deceased are able to provide.

subclassFeature.name: Fortelling
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Dead Ringer
entries: You can ring this bell to cast {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you cast the spell using this trinket, you can ask the corpse only one question.

entries.name: Heptagonal Spectacles
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} once without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Lucent Mirror
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can partially phase into the Ethereal Plane for 1 minute or until you dismiss it (no action required). You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 10 feet and can move through occupied spaces as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. If you end your turn in such a space, you are shunted to the last unoccupied space you were in.

subclassFeature.name: Foretold Demise
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage with a weapon, you can replace one of the damage dice with a foretelling roll.

subclassFeature.name: Whispers from Beyond
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can receive a hint from beyond. The GM gives a one-word hint pertaining to your best course of action, a fruitful line of inquiry, or some other useful direction.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Third Eye
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cast {@spell True Seeing|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you cast the spell with this feature, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack you make on each of your turns for the duration of this spell.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Antiquarian
entries: {@i Wield a Museum's Worth of Powerful Arcane Trinkets}

Festooned with magical trinkets from every corner of the globe, Antiquarians have a tool for every occasion: silver arrowheads for lycanthropes, heartwood stakes for vampires, blessed relics for fiends, and so on. As they expand their collections from piles of trinkets to veritable museums, they become adept historians and arcanists, familiar with the stories of every magic item in their care, as well as how to use them in dire situations.

subclassFeature.name: Artifact Hoarder
entries: You gain one additional use of your {@classFeature Trinkets|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|3} before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Hateful Arrowhead
entries: You can cast {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB} or {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB} spell without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Warped Prism
entries: You can cast {@spell Blur|XPHB} or {@spell Shield|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Razortooth Bandages
entries: You can cast {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB} or {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or deal damage using one of these spells using this trinket, you can add your Investigator level to the healing or damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Relics
entries: You've secured a handful of priceless relics with rare and delicate enchantments. Once you use one of the following relics, you can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Antediluvian Dynamo
entries: You can cast {@spell Fireball|XPHB} or {@spell Lightning Bolt|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Lich's Deathmask
entries: You can cast {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} or {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Mortal Coil
entries: You can cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} or {@spell Revivify|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} using this relic, all previous Undead created using this relic crumble into dust.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Item Collection
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can magically produce a magic item. When you do so, all magic items previously created by this feature vanish. If a magic item you produce requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, you can attune yourself to it the instant you produce it. You can produce the following magic items: a {@item Carpet of Flying|XDMG}, a {@item Cloak of the Bat|XDMG}, a {@item Flame Tongue|XDMG}, {@item Gauntlets of Ogre Power|XDMG}, an {@item Daern's Instant Fortress|XDMG|Instant Fortress}, a {@item Ring of Regeneration|XDMG}, a {@item Ring of Telekinesis|XDMG}, a {@item Sun Blade|XDMG}, or a {@item Wand of Wonder|XDMG}.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Jar
entries: You've secured the crown jewel of your collection: a lich's soul jar, or "phylactery." Though the original owner's soul has been expelled from this accursed artifact, it retains many of its magical properties.

This magic item is always attuned to you and doesn't count against your total number of attuned magic items. It has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the soul jar, you can expend one or more charges to use the following abilities.

entries.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: You can expend 1 charge as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Investigator level.

entries.name: Trinket Recharge
entries: You can expend 1 charge as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to regain one expended use of your {@classFeature Trinkets|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|3}.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can expend 2 charges to drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. You can use this benefit only once per turn.

entries.name: Draining Touch
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend 3 charges to make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} Necrotic damage and you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. If the spell attack misses, these charges aren't expended.

subclassFeature.name: Conspiracy Theorist
entries: {@i Unravel Far-Reaching, Incredulous Conspiracies}

The world is full of stuff that doesn't add up. A natural disaster strikes and they talk about theoretical weather patterns. People forget days at a time and they say some medical jargon about their brains. And nobody seems to notice the folks dressed in black who lurk behind every corner. It's one big coincidence after another. But when you ask the right questions and pull on the right threads, you start uncovering the biggest mysteries: the ones They don't want you to know about.

It's hard to tell who They even are, apart from the fact that They're massively influential and have deep pockets. They have agents everywhere, watching and waiting. What are their goals? What are they working so hard to keep secret? You can't be totally sure, but you have a few good theories.

subclassFeature.name: Paranoid Instincts
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Masonic Charm
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you attach this charm to a weapon you are holding. When you do so, choose a number from 10-19. For 1 minute, your attacks using the weapon score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of that number or a 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Three-Headed Coin
entries: You give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on one {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} before you roll the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Unfathomable Metal
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you reveal this trinket to a creature within 5 feet of you. At the start of each of its turns for 1 minute, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage and then makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the effect continues. On a successful save, the effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Relics
entries: When you take the {@action Ready|XPHB} action, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} you make for the {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. You can only use this feature when the trigger is in response to another creature's action or movement after the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Connect the Dots
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose one skill. You gain proficiency in that skill if you lacked it and {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} with it. This proficiency and {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} lasts until you use this feature to choose a different skill.

subclassFeature.name: Off the Grid
entries: Your ability to avoid others grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Escape Plan
entries: Whenever you take damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Nondetection
entries: You can cast {@spell Nondetection|XPHB} on yourself without a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Containment Specialist
entries: {@i Contain and Conceal Anomalous Magic Artifacts}

Though the study of magic is diverse and wonderous, it contains mysteries better left unexplored. Such topics in magic are seldom studied, for their very existence poses an existential threat to the multiverse itself: chronomancy, protomancy, and quantumancy are among the few graced with names at all. When a sinister (or merely curious) arcanist pulls on one of these threads of knowledge, they open a Pandora's box of unpredictable effects. The results are usually catastrophic. Such dangerous arcana leaves lasting scars on people and objects, metaphysical reverberations of the terrible secrets at their source.

As their title implies, Containment Specialists are tasked with tracking, isolating, and containing exotic magic and its artifacts. Their job is hazardous and challenging, but is of critical importance to the multiverse at large. Containment Specialists often coordinate in clandestine groups to triangulate new threats and ensure isolated ones remain indefinitely contained. With some luck, these organizations can remain obscure footnotes for generations, further sheltering their secrets from curious eyes.

subclassFeature.name: Cover Story
entries: When you fail a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check or a creature catches you in a lie, you can reattempt the check to reassure the listener with another quick lie. On a success, the listener believes you. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Antibell
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Silence|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Black Bag
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can activate your Black Bag, an item linked to numerous extradimensional spaces, for 1 minute. While the bag is active, you can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to place an item in the bag or retrieve one from the bag. Any item placed within the bag is stored in its own extradimensional space, which is suffused by an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}. The bag's mouth is 2 feet in diameter. It can hold up to 12 items, each weighing no more than 50 pounds, and weighs as much as the heaviest object stored within it. When you retrieve an item from the bag, you always grab the item you intended.

entries.name: Cinnabar Compass
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} without using a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Disruption
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Exploit Weakness|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|5} and the target has the Magic Resistance trait, that trait doesn't function until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Nothing to See Here
entries: With a blinding flash, you can overwrite the memories of those around you. You can cast {@spell Modify Memory|XPHB} as an action targeting up to 3 creatures within range without a spell slot or components. You must modify the memories of each creature affected by the spell in the same way.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Containment Dimension
entries: You can leverage a powerful quarantine procedure to keep others safe from dangerous artifacts. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can create a pocket dimension that is an exact duplicate of your surroundings at the moment you use this feature—complete with duplicates of all the structures and nonmagical items therein—and transport creatures you choose within its area to the dimension. You decide the exact area of the duplicate dimension, as long as its total space fits within a 150-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}.

While in the pocket dimension, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures in that dimension. You can't see creatures and objects outside the pocket dimension. Objects taken from the pocket dimension vanish upon leaving it.

If a creature leaves the bounds of the pocket dimension it appears in the corresponding space on the plane it left. If it appears in an occupied space, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes {@damage 4d6} Force damage.

The pocket dimension lasts for 10 minutes, and ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the pocket dimension contains no creatures, or you dismiss it (no action required). When the pocket dimension ends, all creatures and objects are returned to the plane they left in their corresponding locations.
Once you use this feature to create a pocket dimension, you can't do so until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Detective
entries: {@i Chase Down Clues and Crack the Mystery}

Prowling at the edge of darkness, Detectives chase down clues and pull on threads to unravel conspiracies that bring darkness into the world. Sometimes, this requires that you infiltrate a cult's secret meetings, other times it calls on you to reconstruct a person's last moments at a murder scene. No matter what the mystery, however, you know that there is always an explanation.

subclassFeature.name: Uncanny Hunch
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence check or a Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check, you can gain a bonus to the check equal to your Investigator level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Fogstone Periapt
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Glass Medallion
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} on yourself without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Skeleton's Key
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Knock|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you cast the spell using this trinket, its casting is silent.

subclassFeature.name: Predictive Intuition
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can examine the movements of a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the start of your next turn, you can add {@dice 1d6} to attack rolls you make against the target, and the target subtracts {@dice 1d6} from all its attack rolls against you. Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on a target, you can't use it on that target again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Interrogator's Instinct
entries: Your sleuthing experience grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Enchantment Detection
entries: You discern if a creature is cursed, possessed, or has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Illusion Detection
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check you make to discern an illusion.

entries.name: Lie Detection
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check you make to determine if you hear a deliberate lie.

subclassFeature.name: Power of Deduction
entries: You can use your {@subclassFeature Predictive Intuition|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|Detective|ValdaInvestigator|6} on a target an unlimited number of times.

subclassFeature.name: Exterminator
entries: {@i Slay Vampires, Werewolves, and Other Terrible Creatures}

An Exterminator suffers no monster to live. Trained in the art of slaying Aberrations, Fiends, and Undead, you stand against evil where others falter, and draw your blade before others recognize a threat. Grand schemes and plots are less important than retribution against monsters which stalk the night, and your thirst for such retribution is unquenchable. There is always another werewolf to be slain, another vampire to be staked, another demon to be banished; people rarely thank you, but you find satisfaction enough in your work.

subclassFeature.name: Silvered Shield
entries: Your monster hunting experience grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Training
entries: You have training with Medium armor and Shields.

entries.name: Intelligent Defense
entries: While wearing Medium armor, you can add your Intelligence, instead of Dexterity, to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Consecrated Whetstone
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Magic Weapon|XPHB} once without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Gilded Dragon Scale
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder damage. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type for 1 minute.

entries.name: Mimic-Tooth Necklace
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to deal an extra {@damage 2d8} Acid damage to the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Slayer
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Silvered Edge
entries: Your monster-killing expertise grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Flexible Mastery
entries: When you attack with a weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Sap|XPHB} or {@itemMastery Vex|XPHB} property for that attack.

entries.name: Supernatural Strikes
entries: Whenever you deal damage with a weapon, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Killer Instinct
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Exploit Weakness|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|5} twice on your turn, but can't use it against the same target more than once.

subclassFeature.name: Infernum
entries: {@i Bargain with Fiends for Infernal Powers}

The Infernum are Investigators in league with Fiends, either willingly to pursue nefarious ends or unwillingly as the result of an infernal bargain. Each is given a set of enigmatic goals and a fiendish overseer (often an Imp), then left entirely to their own devices. Many search and scrounge for a solution to their fiendish bargain or opt for malicious compliance, delivering upon their infernal directives while undermining their broader schemes. Others, however, revel in their dark alliance, gleefully hoping to climb the fiendish ranks.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Familiar
entries: Your infernal masters have assigned a lesser fiend to supervise and assist you. You add {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} to your grimoire for free. You can use {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} to cast the spell without expending a use of the feature, and you don't need to read from your grimoire to cast it. The spell is improved in the following ways when you cast it.

entries.name: Fiendish Options
entries: You can choose only the following options for your familiar: {@creature Imp|XMM}, {@creature Quasit|XMM}, or {@creature Pseudodragon|XMM}. A pseudodragon summoned with this spell knows Common and is a Fiend.

entries.name: Spiteful Distraction
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command the familiar to disrupt an enemy within 5 feet of it. The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Demon's Eye
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the ability to see normally in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} and {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}—both magical and nonmagical—within 120 feet of yourself for 1 minute.

entries.name: Diabolical Barb
entries: You can cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Hexagram Pendant
entries: You can cast {@spell Hex|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Infernal Bargain
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can strike one of the following bargains with your infernal masters. You can also discuss new bargains with your GM. The bargain lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Blindsight and Blindness
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet. Beyond this range, you have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Damage and Actions
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can choose to take Necrotic damage equal to twice your Investigator level to take an additional action. This action can only be used to take only the {@action Attack|XPHB} (one attack only), {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Resistance and Vulnerability
entries: Choose two of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic, and Thunder. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage types. The GM chooses another type from the list; you have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to that damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Binding Contract
entries: You add Geas to your grimoire for free. When you cast the spell using this feature, you can modify its casting to draft a binding contract. Instead of giving a verbal command, you write a legal contract that can contain up to 10 commands and conditions. You can include clauses that end the spell early or extend its duration to a maximum of 90 days. Instead of targeting a creature that you can see within range, the spell targets any creature that signs the contract within the duration.

A creature that willingly signs the contract as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action automatically fails its saving throw against the spell, whether or not the creature understands the nature of the contract.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Transformation
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to shape-shift your {@subclassFeature Fiendish Familiar|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|Infernum|ValdaInvestigator|3} into one of the following forms: {@creature Barbed Devil|XMM}, {@creature Incubus|XMM}, {@creature Succubus|XMM}, or {@creature Vrock|XMM}. It remains transformed for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required). While transformed, your familiar can attack.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor
entries: {@i Drive Out Fiends and Root out Heresy}

The church has long been the first line of defense against the tide of impending darkness. Yet, the clergy's stubborn devotion to righteousness impedes them where it counts: you must sometimes be willing to do evil to counter evil. That's where the inquisition comes in.

As a righteous Inquisitor, you are tasked with rooting out heresy, exorcising demons, and stamping out any sign of the occult, and you are offered clemency for any action you take in the defense of the greater good. You may investigate anyone or anything you deem to be in line with the forces of evil, for you alone are a holy blade in the dark, the arbiter of your church.

subclassFeature.name: Exorcist's Doctrines
entries: Your training as an inquisitor grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Consecrated Armor
entries: You add {@spell Consecrated Armor|ValdaSpire24} to your grimoire for free. When you cast it, your base AC becomes 13 plus your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Dogma
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill Religion|XPHB}) check, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Alabaster Balm
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Hallowed Chalice
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can enchant a container, such as a cup, that you touch to produce a flask of {@item Holy Water|XPHB}. You can produce one such flask when you use this trinket. For the next hour, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to produce another flask of {@item Holy Water|XPHB}, until you have created a total of five flasks. Once created, these flasks and {@item Holy Water|XPHB} vanish after 1 hour.

entries.name: Reliquary of Doubt
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you cast the spell using this trinket, you can only detect thoughts associated with negative emotions, such as guilt, apprehension, regret, or melancholy.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Rote Piety
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Holy Trinkets|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|7} three times without expending a use of your {@classFeature Trinkets|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|3}. You regain these uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Excommunication
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can emblazon a mark of condemnation upon a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be marked for 1 minute. While marked, the target takes {@damage 6d6} Radiant damage at the start of each of its turns, can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and can't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}. A marked target can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Once you mark a creature using this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Kid Sleuth
entries: {@i Solve Mysteries with Your Talking Animal Sidekick}

Though Kid Sleuths are not all literally youths, they are all amateur detectives with a knack for solving tricky crimes. Assisted by their ubiquitous animal sidekicks, Kid Sleuths will happily dive into the details of a grim crime scene to emerge with a handful of clues and a lead on the bad guy. These sleuths generally prefer to run away from trouble, rather than engage head-on, since mysteries only get harder to solve with more dead bodies, but they are more than capable of defending themselves if backed into a corner.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Sidekick
entries: You gain a Kid Sleuth's constant companion: a talking animal sidekick. You add {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} to your grimoire for free. You can use {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} to cast the spell without expending a use of the feature, and you don't need to read from your grimoire to cast it. The spell is improved in the following ways when you cast it.

entries.name: Expanded Options
entries: You can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature Goat|XMM}, {@creature Mastiff|XMM}, or {@creature Weasel|XMM}.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: The animal gains an Intelligence of 10 and the ability to speak one language you know.

entries.name: Skillful
entries: Your familiar gains proficiency in any combination of two skills or tools of your choice. You can change this selection when you summon your familiar.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Bag of Traps
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can magically produce and take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to use one of the following items: {@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}, {@item Caltrops|XPHB}, {@item Chain|XPHB}, {@item Hunting Trap|XPHB}, {@item Manacles|XPHB}, or {@item Oil|XPHB} (which you can only use to douse a space). If the item requires a saving throw, it uses your Investigator spell save DC. For the next minute, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to produce and use another such item, until you have created a total of five items. Once created, these items vanish after 1 hour.

entries.name: Dooby Snack
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you produce a tasty treat that lasts for 1 hour. A creature can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to eat this treat to gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). Until the start of its next turn, the creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes.

entries.name: Magnifying Glass
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Clue|ValdaSpire24} without a spell slot or components. Additionally, when you cast this spell using this trinket, you can determine each type of creature that leaves footprints or fingerprints.

subclassFeature.name: Split Up, Gang
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Exploit Weakness|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|5}, you can immediately move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. Alternatively, you can choose one ally you can see within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you. The ally can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Companion
entries: When your familiar takes the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Hide|XPHB} action, you gain the benefits of that action on your next turn. You must be {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} or behind Three-Quarters {@variantrule Cover|XPHB} or Total cover, and you must be out of any enemy's line of sight to gain the benefits of the {@action Hide|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Meddling Kids
entries: Whenever an enemy within 30 feet of yourself makes an attack roll against one of your allies, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist
entries: {@i Expand Your Rituals Through Ancient Lore}

Though most Investigators fill their grimoires with hard- won knowledge borne from encounters with supernatural threats, some prefer to do bookkeeping instead. Such Archivists seek to accumulate knowledge, more so than trinkets, by spending untold hours digging through disparate tomes of occult secrets and compiling them into encyclopedic texts. Through their research, Archivists become academic masters of the arcane and priceless reservoirs of obscure knowledge.

subclassFeature.name: Thesis
entries: You gain access to certain spells associated with your thesis. Choose one of the following subject areas for your thesis: {@filter Corpus|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), corpus}, {@filter Mentis|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), mentis}, {@filter Mortis|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), mortis}, or {@filter Oculus|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), oculus}. Consult the table below that corresponds to the chosen thesis; you add the listed spells for your Investigator level to your grimoire for free. The listed spells count as Investigator spells for you and you treat them if they have the {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} tag.

Whenever you gain an Investigator level, you can replace your thesis with another one. The spells in your grimoire corresponding to your thesis are magically replaced with those of the new thesis for your Investigator level.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Aura Lenses
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Mnemonic Script
entries: You can cast {@spell Memorize|ValdaSpire24} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Tongue Stone
entries: You can cast {@spell Comprehend Languages|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Erudite Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can give one target of the spell {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saves against the spell.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Encyclopedic Expertise
entries: You can identify any arcane effect from memory. Whenever you see or hear a spell being cast or investigate a magical effect, you can identify the spell that was cast, the magic item responsible, or the creature that produced the effect without an ability check. This feature fails to {@spell identify|XPHB} spells, magic items, and creatures that are utterly unique or are otherwise not recorded in arcane texts.

subclassFeature.name: Eidetic Memory
entries: You can effortlessly duplicate spells you see or hear, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Ritual Recall
entries: If you see or hear an Investigator spell being cast, you can thereafter copy it into your grimoire.

entries.name: Spell Duplication
entries: When you see or hear a spell of level 5 or lower being cast, you can fix the spell in your mind. Within the next minute, you can expend a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} to cast the spell without a spell slot. Once you use this benefit to cast a spell, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

action.name: Leech
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Necrotic damage and the snail regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fright can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The grep can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a whisper or chitter. A hearer can discern the sounds are imitations with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Slashing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jelly can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The jelly sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) Poison damage.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mock adheres to anything that touches it. The mock has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any creature adhered to it. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the mock as an action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Acid damage.

bonus.name: Shape-Shift
entries: The mock shape-shifts to resemble a Tiny object while retaining its game statistics, or it returns to its true blob form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

trait.name: Just a Rock
entries: The rock counts as an object. Additionally, it can't take actions and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} can't be increased.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The pup has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the pup's {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} is within 5 feet of the creature and the {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Cold damage.

action.name: Bayonet
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Rifle {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, one creature that the tin soldier can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Piercing damage.

monster.name: Yarn Golem
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

action.name: Poke
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Tangle {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, one creature that the golem can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 12}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Witch level (the familiar has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Witch level)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The familiar two Rend attacks. When you reach Witch level 17, it makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8 + 4} plus your Charisma modifier Force damage.

bonus.name: Rampage
entries: Immediately after dealing damage to a creature that is already {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, the familiar moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Rend attack.

monster.name: Skeleton
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 80/320 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Grave Touch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Necrotic damage.

monster.name: Zombie
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 5} plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. On a successful save, the zombie drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Bone Beast
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The beast has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Large or smaller.

monster.name: Gorger
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 13}).

monster.name: Deadnaught

hp.special: 10 plus five times your Necromancer level (the deadnaught has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Necromancer level)

languages: understands the languages you know but can't speak

trait.name: Necromantic Bond
entries: You can only animate and control a deadnaught once you reach Necromancer level 7. While you control a deadnaught, you can't control other thralls.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The deadnaught regains 5 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deadnaught makes two attacks. It makes three attacks when you reach Necromancer level 13, and four attacks when you reach Necromancer level 17.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 4} Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The bloodlurk can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bloodlurk can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Blood Splash
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, each creature of the bloodlurk's choice in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} origination from the lurker. {@actSaveFail} 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Necrotic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The slaymate can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check.

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Slashing damage.

monster.name: Duskfog
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The duskfog can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Misty Embrace
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, one creature the duskfog can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Necrotic damage and the duskfog regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

monsterFluff.name: Death Snail
entries: A death snail is formed from a vile concoction of forest troll bone meal, giant eagle blood, and goblin fingernails, sealed up in a hollowed-out efreet horn, and capped shut with an ettercap tongue. The resulting monstrosity possesses a dull intelligence, but its only impulse is to slay all creatures other than its master.

monsterFluff.name: Flying Book
entries: Little can be said about the flying book that is not readily apparent. Though it is indistinguishable from an arcanist's spellbook while motionless, this animated arcane tome can flutter through the air at a moment's notice, using its cover as rudimentary wings. Flying books are playful, and enjoy the sensation of being written in.

monsterFluff.name: Fright
entries: Hauntings can usually be attributed to the usual spectral suspects: ghosts, specters, shadows, and poltergeists. But benign hauntings, where the restless spirit merely plays tricks on the living, is usually caused by a fright. These spirits are usually the artifacts of children or entertainers, clinging to the afterlife for company and a semblance of affection, and are as such preoccupied with fun. They never willingly harm others when they haunt a house, and will serve any master that conjures them, if only for the sake of inclusion.

monsterFluff.name: Grep
entries: A grep is an underground scavenger, known for using its keen vision, acute hearing, and silent flight to trick and steal from travelers, hoarding its possessions in well- hidden troves. Arcanists use greps as messengers and scouts, but they excel as retrievers; a grep can be given the name of an important object and sent to find it, returning a short time later with its prize.

monsterFluff.name: Mock
entries: The diminutive relative of the mimic, the mock is a tiny shapechanger that replicates small, valuable objects to lure in its victims. In the desert, a mock might take the form of a canteen of precious water, and in a dungeon, it may replicate a sizeable jewel or a spare gold piece. If an adventurer is caught by surprise, a mock is just as dangerous as its larger relatives, for can hide in far less conspicuous places.

monsterFluff.name: Moon Jelly
entries: Though incapable of surviving on land, moon jellies are favored for their bioluminescence by witches that intend to explore deep underwater.

monsterFluff.name: Pet Rock
entries: Widely considered to be the perfect familiar, requiring no food or water and possessing extremely high natural defenses, a pet rock can be conjured by most spellcasters. Though it does not act with any agility (indeed, it does not move at all), it can make a formidable weapon when thrown.

monsterFluff.name: Rag Doll
entries: Crudely constructed, but oddly endearing, rag dolls are constructs formed from children's toys, stuffed with soft material and adorned with smiling faces. Besides being generally comforting to have around, spellcasters favor rag dolls as familiars for their fairly durable construction and inconspicuous nature; nobody questions a discarded doll, after all.

monsterFluff.name: Tin Soldier
entries: Full of ticking clockwork and mechanical gizmos, tin soldiers are mechanical creations fashioned by arcanists as servants and messengers. With some patience and skill, almost anyone can build a tin soldier, but spellcasters have long devised methods to conjure them wholesale from the Plane of Law's excess energies.

monsterFluff.name: Winter Wolf Pup
entries: When fully grown, a winter wolf is an apex predator of the snow, a terror of teeth and fur, stalking the tundra in packs. But before they develop their fearsome freezing breath, winter wolf pups are far more amicable (perhaps because they have yet to realize the scope of their own might), and will dutifully follow a master that feeds them well and treats them with respect.

monsterFluff.name: Yarn Golem
entries: The greatest of golems are formed of iron, stone, and clay, but the least of them are constructed of yarn. Balled and sewn into a vaguely humanoid shape, yarn golems are among the first animated objects that arcanists learn to create, practicing with them obsessively until they master the basics and move onto more rigid materials. Yarn golems are friendly and playful, but risk foolishly unraveling themselves if they catch on sharp objects.

monsterFluff.name: Zombie
entries: A zombie is the rotting remains of the once living, held together and driven by dark magic.

monsterFluff.name: Bone Beast
entries: Constructed of haphazardly assembled humanoid bones, a bone beast looks nothing like a man. Lumbering about on four legs with great boney fangs, the beast can run as fast as a bear and strike as viciously as a lion.

monsterFluff.name: Gorger
entries: An unholy tangling of flesh, the gorger still vaguely resembles a humanoid in profile, except for the gaping, toothed maw in its chest. Its colossal teeth are little more than sharpened ribs, but its monstrous bite can easily decapitate.

monsterFluff.name: Deadnaught
entries: An Undead hulk clad in heavy armor, a deadnaught is a Necromancer's most fearsome ally.

entries.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple and Martial weapons; Light, Medium, and Heavy armor, Shields. The monster can equip any gear for which it has proficiency or training.

monsterFluff.name: Bloodlurk
entries: An awful hybrid of Undead and Ooze, a bloodlurk is animated from the coagulated blood of the dead and bubbles with necromantic malice.

monsterFluff.name: Spirit
entries: A spirit is the scarcely tangible echo of humanoid, a soul bound to the mortal realm by necromantic magic.

monsterFluff.name: Skeleton
entries: The renanimated remains of humanoids long since dead, skeletons are puppets of bone held aloft by strings of magic.

spell.name: Arcane Anomaly
entries: You create a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you that distorts magical energy. For the duration, whenever a spell is cast within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5 or 6, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

spell.name: Accursed Act
entries: Lighting a candle, you attempt to curse a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for the duration. Until the spell ends, the creature takes Psychic damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier whenever it makes an attack roll or casts a spell. The target only takes this damage once per turn. The spell ends early if the target doesn't attack or cast a spell on its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Candy Blast
entries: You summon a handful of hard candy—boiled sweets, mints, jelly beans, etc.—and hurl them at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage and the candy forms a pile on the ground in its space, causing a 5-foot-square area of your choice in the target's space to become {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. The candy produced by this pell is edible, but has no nutritional value, and vanishes after 1 minute, ending any {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Corruption Curse
entries: With a piercing glare and a sinister gesture, you send ribbons of dark magic toward a creature you can see within range. For the duration, the target is cursed and suffers one of the following effects of your choice.

entries.name: Dull Reflexes
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Feeble Fortitude
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws and can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Weak Will
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom saving throws and spell attack rolls.

spell.name: Curse of Aging
entries: A creature you touch must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed to age and wither. While cursed, the target ages at ten times the normal rate, becoming ten days older for each day that passes. Additionally, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws.

spell.name: Curse of Binding

components.m: a body part from the intended target, such as a fingernail, a lock of hair, or a drop of blood

entries: You attempt to bind a creature or object to a location. Choose a target and a point within range that you can see. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be cursed to remain within 30 feet of the point. If the target starts its turn further than 30 feet from the point, it must succeed on a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC or be dragged 60 feet toward the point. Additionally, if the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the attempt fails and wastes the spell or effect. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse of Blades
entries: You attempt to drive a creature you can see within range to violence. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed and have the Frenzied condition for the duration.

A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.
At the end of its turn, an affected creature can repeat its saving throw, ending the spell early on a success.

spell.name: Curse of Chains
entries: A black brand resembling iron shackles appears on a creature you can see within range, which must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. The target can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse Ward
entries: You reach out your hand and touch a willing creature, raising a smoke-like barrier around it. For the duration, the target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage and can't be cursed or possessed. If the target is already under one of these effects, the effect is suppressed until the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse Object

m.text: powdered onyx worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You bestow a curse upon an object that you touch. The object must be one that isn't being worn or carried and is able to fit within a 5-foot cube. Until the spell ends, the object becomes magical (requiring attunement) and cursed. The fact that the object is cursed is revealed only when an Identify spell is cast on it or a creature attunes to it. When a creature attunes to the object, the curse extends to it for the duration. Choose the curse from the following effects.

entries.name: Bleeding
entries: The attuned creature can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Frenzied (Weapon Only)
entries: Whenever the attuned creature deals damage with the cursed weapon, it has the Frenzied condition for 1 minute. A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.

entries.name: Hobbled
entries: The attuned creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and can't take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Obsessed
entries: The attuned creature is unwilling to part with the object, keeping it on its person at all times. If the cursed object is a weapon, the attuned creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with weapons other than the cursed weapon.

entries.name: Restless
entries: Whenever the attuned creature finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain no benefits from the rest.

entries.name: Speechless
entries: The attuned creature can't speak.

entries.name: Unfortunate
entries: Whenever the target rolls a 20 on the {@dice d20} of a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the roll instead becomes a 1.

entries.name: Vulnerable
entries: The attuned creature has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to one damage type (choose when you cast this spell).

spell.name: Demand

components.m: a snake's tongue and a piece of copper wire

entries: This spell projects a select Enchantment spell to a target, regardless of distance. When you cast {@spell Charm Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB}, {@spell Geas|XPHB}, or {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}, before this spell ends, you modify its casting so that its range becomes unlimited. This spell then ends.

Choose a target with which you are familiar (whether or not you can see it) for the Enchantment spell. If the spell requires a verbal command, the creature hears the command in its mind and recognizes you as the sender if it knows you.

You can project the spell across any distance, and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a {@chance 5} chance that the Enchantment spell fails and has no effect.

spell.name: Eldritch Orb
entries: You fling a ball of eldritch energy at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage and explodes in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking half the amount of Force damage on a failed save, or none on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Elemental Curse
entries: A spark leaps from your finger to a creature you touch, spreading in bright cracks across its skin. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed for the duration. The cursed target has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage. If the creature has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it instead loses that {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}. If the target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it instead has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type.

spell.name: Exhume
entries: Choose an unoccupied 20-foot square on the ground within range. This spell causes one pile of Humanoid bones to rise out of the ground within that square. If you cast this spell within a burial place such as a graveyard, mausoleum, or barrow, {@dice 1d4} corpses or piles of bones are exhumed. The ground itself isn't disturbed by this spell; the bones simply appear out of the ground.

spell.name: Face Swap
entries: You place an {@condition invisible} sigil on a willing target you can see within range. This sigil lasts until the spell ends.

For the duration, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to project your face onto the marked creature until you dismiss the effect (no action required). When you do so, you can see, hear, and speak through the marked creature as if you occupied its space. You use your senses instead of those of the marked creature.

spell.name: Flawed Reconstruction
entries: You stitch together the wounds of a creature you touch, which regains {@dice 3d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. However, the mending is imperfect, and the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by {@dice 1d6}, to a minimum of 1.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 2d6} and the reduction increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Frenzy
entries: With a gesture, you reduce a crowd to base instinct and violence. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point you choose within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature has the Frenzied condition for the duration.

A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.
The Frenzied condition ends after 1 minute, or when the spell ends. At the end of its turn, an affected creature can repeat its saving throw, ending the condition on itself early on a success.

spell.name: Gahoul's Scapegoat
entries: You trace a complex arcane symbol on the flesh of a willing creature you touch, marking it for sacrifice. When you are hit by an attack roll during the spell's duration and the marked creature is within 60 feet of yourself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport, swapping places with the creature and forcing it to be hit by the attack instead of you. The spell then ends.

spell.name: Hex: Abate
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Apathy
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} about creatures of your choice that it is {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} toward. This indifference ends if the target takes damage or is forced to make a saving throw. When the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the creature's attitude returns to normal.

spell.name: Hex: Bleeding
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, each time the target takes damage until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, it takes an extra {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage. If the target is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage instead.

spell.name: Hex: Charm
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if you or your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. The spell ends early if you or your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} deal damage to the target. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.

spell.name: Hex: Disorient
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must subtract {@dice 1d4} from attack rolls it makes until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The die subtracted from attack rolls changes when you reach level 5 ({@dice 1d6}), 11 ({@dice 1d8}), and 17 ({@dice 1d10}).

spell.name: Hex: Doomward
entries: You touch a willing creature. The first time the target would drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the target instead drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, and the spell ends. This spell has no effect if you have cast this spell on the target within the past 24 hours.

spell.name: Hex: Duplicity
entries: You create an illusory duplicate of yourself in your space. When a creature hits you with an attack before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, roll a {@dice d6}. On 4 or higher, the attack strikes the duplicate instead of you and the spell ends. The duplicate otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition, {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, or {@sense Truesight|XPHB}.

spell.name: Hex: Evil Eye
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Fortune
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws.

spell.name: Hex: Garble
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't speak coherently or cast spells with a Verbal component until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Go Unseen
entries: Repeating an ancient chant, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. Creatures within 10 feet of yourself that can hear can detect your location for the spell's duration. The spell ends early if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

spell.name: Hex: Hobble
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 10 feet until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. If the target is flying, it falls, unless it has the ability to hover.

spell.name: Hex: Mire
entries: You transform the ground in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you into murky swamp, which is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. This {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement.

spell.name: Hex: Misfortune
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. Until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, whenever the target rolls a 20 on the {@dice d20} of a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the roll instead becomes a 1.

spell.name: Hex: Obfuscate
entries: You produce fog in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. This fog lasts until the spell ends at the end of your next turn or until a strong wind (such as one created by {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}) disperses it, ending the spell.

spell.name: Hex: Peacebond
entries: You create a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you that locks weapons to their containers. The weapons and ammunition of each creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} become fixed in their sheaths, quivers, or holsters until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. A creature can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC, freeing an item from its container on a success.

spell.name: Hex: Pox
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Ruin
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has a -2 penalty to AC until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The penalty to AC increases by 1 when you reach levels 5 (-3), 11 (-4), and 17 (-5).

spell.name: Hex: Stupor
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell's effect. Once the spell ends on a target, it is immune to this spell for the next 24 hours.

spell.name: Hex: Tremors
entries: A miniature earthquake shakes the ground in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each creature on the ground in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature that enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or ends its turn there must also succeed on that save or fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Ward
entries: You touch a willing creature. Each time the target takes damage before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the damage it takes is reduced by 2.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage reduction increases by 1 when you reach levels 5 (-3), 11 (-4) and 17 (-5).

spell.name: Hocuspocus
entries: You conjure minor paranormal phenomena and other ominous effects. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its effects active at a time.

entries.name: Grave Mists
entries: A rolling fog gathers on the ground in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Ominous Lights
entries: You cause all candles, torches, and other open flames to darken and flicker for 1 minute.

entries.name: Paranormal Chill
entries: You can chill or warm the air in a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} by 10 degrees for 1 minute.

entries.name: Poltergeist Activity
entries: You cause small, unattended objects to rattle or levitate an inch off the ground for 1 minute.

entries.name: Spirit Orbs
entries: You create up to four fist-sized spectral, glowing orbs, which float around within range for 1 minute. The orbs don't provide light, apart from a dim glow.

entries.name: Spooky Noises
entries: You create a quiet sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as ominous whispers, the drone of insects, or the sound of crying. The sound lasts for 1 minute.

spell.name: Hollowing Curse
entries: Tendrils of vitality-draining mist extend from your fingertips. A creature you can see within range makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage and is cursed for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

On each of your subsequent turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to deal damage to the cursed creature. The damage equals {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage if you took the {@action Magic|XPHB} action or half as much if you took a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Identity Curse
entries: You touch a creature's temple and attempt to erase its identity. One creature you touch makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 hour and is cursed to forget its identity. When the target awakens, it loses all its personal memories, though it retains its general knowledge, proficiencies, and other statistics. The target doesn't realize it has any class features, feats, or magical abilities, and so doesn't willingly use them unless it rediscovers them. If left to its own devices, the target will quickly adopt a new name and begin to build a new identity. When the spell ends, the target regains its past memories.

spell.name: Intrusive Thought

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of yourself making an attack roll

entries: You attempt to distort a creature's thinking. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or automatically miss with the triggering attack.

spell.name: Mandy's Enchanted Carriage
entries: You shape-shift a vegetable into a Large magical carriage, complete with reins and two quasi-real horses. The carriage is luxurious and carries up to six passengers—four within and two atop it at the coach's seat.
